0.title: India reports 21,566 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,48,881
0.article_body: India has reported 21,566 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after India reported 20,557 new cases. The number of active COVID-19 cases now stands at 1,48,881. The COVID-19 death toll has risen to 5,25,870 after 45 persons lost their lives in the last 24 hours.

1.title: Sanjay Dutt's cancer diagnosis came as shock to us: 'Shamshera' director
1.article_body: 'Shamshera' director Karan Malhotra opened up about actor Sanjay Dutt's battle with cancer during the film's shoot. "The news that Sanjay sir had been diagnosed with cancer came to all of us like a huge shock. We had no idea about it," he stated. Calling Sanjay a superman, Karan said, "He is an inspiration on the sets for everyone."

2.title: Kohli, Rohit were forced to play away from their body against Topley: Hogg
2.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma were forced to play away from the body when the ball didn't come back in, while batting against England pacer Reece Topley in the recent ODI series. "That was their downfall [against Topley who gets extra bounce]," added Hogg. Topley dismissed Rohit Sharma twice in the three-match ODI series.

3.title: Cases of manhole cover thefts on rise in Mumbai; BMC blames drug addicts
3.article_body: Cases of manhole cover thefts are on a rise in Mumbai this monsoon with police registering over 200 FIRs in the matter. One manhole cover is priced between ₹2,500-₹10,000. According to a BMC official, drug peddlers and drug addicts are more inclined to such thefts. The thieves operate during night and pull the cover using a magnet, the official said.

4.title: Tharoor shares WhatsApp forward on GST on 'Paneer Butter Masala' after hike
4.article_body: As 'Paneer Butter Masala' trended on social media amid controversy over 5% GST on packaged daily use food items, MP Shashi Tharoor shared a WhatsApp forward saying, "This one skewers the folly of the GST as few jokes have!" The Centre has recently imposed 5% GST on daily-use food items, including curd, wheat, pulses, only if they are packed.

5.title: SC allows 27% OBC reservation in Maharashtra local body elections
5.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday allowed 27% reservation for Other Backward Classes (OBCs) in the upcoming local body elections in Maharashtra. "We want elections to be held...we are making it loud and clear to all of you. Let the election process commence," SC told the Maharashtra State Election Commission. The poll process for 367 local bodies has started, SC was informed.

6.title: There might be rivalry between actresses, but it’s good: Raveena Tandon
6.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon said that there might be a rivalry between actresses, however, it's a good and healthy rivalry as it brings out the best in them. "Actresses I've worked with have been friends for so long. It's not necessary for you to get along with everyone," she added while speaking about the rivalry between actresses in the early days.

7.title: Uniting Oppn most crucial thing at the moment: Margaret Alva
7.article_body: Opposition’s Vice President candidate Margaret Alva said she feels that uniting the Opposition is the most crucial thing at the moment. "It’s not a question of winning or losing, it’s a question of responding to a challenge before the nation," she added. "There will be various steps which bring them together, I think this is one of those," Alva stated.

8.title: MCD to levy 'garbage user charges' on more commercial properties
8.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) is planning to levy 'garbage user charges' on more number of commercial properties so that its present fee collection of ₹18-₹19 lakh a month increases to about ₹10 crore a month, officials said. The MCD can charge ₹50-₹200 a month as garbage user fee from residential properties depending on their area, according to by-laws.

9.title: 'Revadi culture' may push Gujarat towards Sri Lanka-like crisis: BJP
9.article_body: Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil warned the public to not get misguided by "revadi culture" of freebies as it could push the state and country into a Sri Lanka-like crisis. Paatil's statement comes after  AAP's national convener Arvind Kejriwal promised free electricity to people if the party is voted to power in Gujarat after this year's Assembly elections.

10.title: Hyderabad Mayor urges GHMC to expedite flood-prevention works
10.article_body: Hyderabad Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal on Wednesday inspected several canal works being carried out under the Strategic Nala Development Programme (SNDP) in LB Nagar zone. She directed officials of the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) to expedite the flood-prevention works while taking all precautionary measures. Gadwal also observed the newly constructed dams at Saroornagar lake.

11.title: 2 bikes, school van catch fire in  24 hours in Pune
11.article_body: Three incidents of vehicles catching fire have been reported in Pune. In the first incident, a TVS Jupiter bike caught fire on the main road near Bharati Vidyapeeth following a technical snag on Wednesday. Another two-wheeler in transit caught fire at Mukund Nagar on Tuesday. A school van that had developed a technical glitch also caught fire near Sundarban society.

12.title: Was in tears after Dennis Lillee said I won't play for SL: Chaminda Vaas
12.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka pacer Chaminda Vaas said he was in "tears" after ex-Australia pacer Dennis Lillee once said that he won't play for his nation. "I [took it as a challenge, going on to represent Sri Lanka] for 15 years," added Vaas. Vaas stated he reminded Lillee about his prediction after playing 60 matches and 100 Tests for Sri Lanka respectively.

13.title: Critic gave half a star to 'Main...', was like 'F**k the reviews': Farah Khan
13.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan recalled a critic's reaction to her directorial debut film 'Main Hoon Na', which starred Shah Rukh Khan. Farah revealed a critic had given her film half a star and the headline read 'Main Hoon Naaaah!'. "It held strongly on Monday...Tuesday (after the first weekend)...I was like 'F**k the reviews. People are loving the film'," she added.

14.title: I'd find every possible way to have both Pant & Karthik in my team: Ponting
14.article_body: Talking about India's possible playing XI for the 2022 T20 World Cup, ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting said he would've tried every possible way to have both Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik in his T20I side. "Rishabh to bat, in that three-four-five range, and have Dinesh and Hardik Pandya...[as finishers]," stated Ponting. "I don't think Suryakumar will miss out," he added.

15.title: FIR against Ghatkopar builder for forgery and illegal sale of flats
15.article_body: An FIR has been lodged against builder 'Yog Realty' for misleading 45 tenants of Bhaveshwar Housing Society, Ghatkopar, Mumbai as the flats they were supposed to get in the redeveloped towers were illegally sold to other people. The developer allegedly misled even Bombay High Court on allotments of flats to tenants. The tenants alleged a scam of over ₹15 crore.

16.title: Fake courier service busted in Bengaluru, 4 people arrested
16.article_body: Bengaluru Police on Wednesday busted a fake courier service operating in the city and arrested four accused persons. According to DCP (North East) Anoop A Shetty, the accused used to display google ads with their phone numbers as booking contacts of popular courier companies. "Do not blindly believe whatever is displayed on the top of...Google search," Shetty tweeted.

17.title: Libya resumes oil exports after pause since April
17.article_body: Libya on Wednesday resumed its export of oil after a pause since April. The resumption came after Libya restarted production at oil fields following the firing of the Chairman of the state-run National Oil Corporation by one of the country's rival governments. Tribal leaders aligned with one of the governments had shut down the oil facilities in April.

18.title: Govt reviews situation of 9 states showing rise in COVID-19 cases; names released
18.article_body: Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan reviewed the COVID-19 situation of Kerala, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, Assam, Andhra Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Mizoram and Arunachal Pradesh. "These states are either reporting a surge in new daily COVID-19 cases or a rise in positivity," the Centre said. They were urged to improve testing, increase surveillance and speed up COVID-19 vaccination.

19.title: NZ's Bracewell becomes 1st cricketer to take hat-trick in his 1st ever over in T20Is
19.article_body: New Zealand all-rounder Michael Bracewell has become the first cricketer to take hat-trick in his first-ever over in T20I cricket. The 31-year-old off-spinner dismissed Ireland's Mark Adair, Barry McCarthy and Craig Young in consecutive deliveries to achieve the feat. His figures in the match read 0.5-0-5-3. Overall, he's the third New Zealand cricketer to take hat-trick in men's T20I cricket.

20.title: How does the World Test Championship table read after Pakistan's record victory?
20.article_body: After recording the highest successful Test run chase in Galle to defeat Sri Lanka in the first Test, Pakistan now have 58.33% of points won in the World Test Championship (WTC). Pakistan are on the third position on the WTC points table, while Sri Lanka are sixth with 48.15% of points won. India are fourth on the table.

21.title: Man dressed as elderly woman robs bank in US; police release pictures
21.article_body: Police in US' Georgia have released pictures after a man dressed as an elderly woman robbed a bank. "The suspect...presented a note demanding money. The suspect told the teller he had a gun. The suspect is described as a black male, approximately 6 foot tall and slender," police said. Police added that the suspect was wearing a floral dress.

22.title: RTI activist held over extorting ₹2 cr from highway contractor in Pune
22.article_body: Pune City Police arrested a 46-year-old Right to Information (RTI) activist for allegedly trying to extort ₹2 crore from a National Highway road contractor. The complainant's company had got a contract for the construction of a road in Ahmednagar district. The accused complained that the work being done by the complainant's company was illegal and allegedly demanded ₹2 crore.

23.title: Russia expanding its war goals in Ukraine: Russian Foreign Minister
23.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Wednesday said that Russia's "special military operation" now went beyond the Donbas region. Lavrov also said that peace talks made no sense at the moment because Western governments were leaning on Ukraine to fight rather than negotiate. In response, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said, "Russians want blood, not talks."

24.title: 3 held over ₹38 lakh robbery with chilli powder in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar
24.article_body: Delhi Police arrested three men for allegedly robbing two collection agents of ₹38 lakh using chilli powder in Lajpat Nagar's Defence Colony Flyover. The agents were in the area to collect payments from garment traders, police said. They were going back in an auto-rickshaw and the assailants, who were on bikes, threw chilli powder in their eyes, police added.

25.title: 4 arrested in Delhi for extorting money through a Chinese loan app
25.article_body: Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested four persons for allegedly running an extortion racket with two Chinese nationals through a Chinese loan application. The accused had employed 149 people as tele-callers to extort money from people by using their loan applications and sending them morphed photographs. The accused siphoned off an amount of ₹10 crore to the two Chinese nationals.

26.title: 'Whale vomit' worth ₹2.6 crore seized in Mumbai; accused arrested
26.article_body: The Mumbai Crime Branch on Wednesday arrested a man for trying to smuggle ambergris, or 'whale vomit', worth ₹2.6 crore. The police seized 2.8 kg of ambergris from the accused, identified as Vaibhav Janardhan Kalekar. Sale of ambergris is prohibited in India as sperm whales, an endangered species, are protected under the Wildlife Protection Act (WPA) of 1927.

27.title: Five people killed as dumper overturns on an SUV in UP's Raebareli
27.article_body: Two children among five people were killed after a fly ash-filled dumper overturned on an SUV in Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli, the police said. They further added that three people were critically injured and are undergoing treatment at a hospital. The bodies of the deceased were taken out with the help of a JCB and sent for post mortem examination.

28.title: 2 men die of electrocution in Shimla, ₹10,000 aid announced
28.article_body: Two men were electrocuted in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla on Wednesday evening, the state disaster management department said. Aman Sharma and Amar Singh were electrocuted while working on an electric pole. The state department said that an instant relief of ₹10,000 each has been given to the family of the two men.

29.title: Tripura CM Manik Saha tests positive for COVID-19
29.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha on Wednesday said that he has tested positive for COVID-19. "I'm absolutely fit and fine with no symptoms. I humbly request all those who've come in contact with me to take necessary precautions," the CM wrote in a Facebook post. Earlier in the day, he inaugurated an oxygen plant at IGM Hospital in Agartala.

30.title: NIA arrests 7th accused in Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh case
30.article_body: The National Investigation Agency on Wednesday arrested the seventh accused in the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh case. Ali Asgar alias Abdullah, a resident of East Champaran district in Bihar, was arrested after the NIA conducted searches in Bihar in connection with the case. Asgar is a radicalized individual involved in propagating jihad by posting incriminating materials online, the NIA said.

31.title: Karnataka CM Bommai assures funds for Cauvery Basin development
31.article_body: The Chief Minister of Karnataka Basavaraj Bommai said that financial grants would be provided for developmental works in the Cauvery Basin. Bommai expressed his happiness at KRS and Kabini dams being filled to the brim this year. Responding to Tamil Nadu CM's statement for an emergency meeting over the Mekedatu project, Bommai said he would issue a statement soon.

32.title: Tanushree claims she's being harassed by Bollywood mafia, says 'I won't die by suicide'
32.article_body: Tanushree Dutta has claimed that she's being "harassed and targeted very badly". She added that she won't die by suicide and she'll resurrect her career. "Bollywood Mafia, the old political circuit of Maharashtra...and nefarious anti-national criminal elements together usually operate like this to trouble people. I'm very sure the #metoo culprits...are behind all this," said Tanushree.

33.title: US-Africa summit to be held in December: Biden
33.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Wednesday said the United States will host an African nations summit in December to discuss food security and climate change. The US-Africa Leaders Summit will be held from December 13 to 15 and about 50 African leaders are expected to participate. Separately, the US has announced $1.3 billion aid for Ethiopia, Kenya and Somalia.

34.title: Jasprit Bumrah loses world number one ODI bowler spot to Trent Boult
34.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday released the latest rankings for men's ODI bowlers. India pacer Jasprit Bumrah, who didn't feature in India's third ODI against England, dropped to the second spot in the rankings. New Zealand fast bowler Trent Boult replaced him as the world number one ODI bowler. Meanwhile, India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal jumped four spots to the 16th position

35.title: Which departments have highest no. of vacancies out of 9.79 lakh vacant posts in Centre?
35.article_body: The Centre informed Lok Sabha that there are around 9.79 lakh vacant posts in various ministries/departments of central government, as per the Annual Report of Pay Research Unit of Department of Expenditure. As per the report, Railways Ministry has the highest vacancies (2.93 lakh), followed by Defence Ministry (Civilian- 2.64 lakh), Home Ministry (1.43 lakh) and Department of Post (90,050).

36.title: BJP workers hold protest after girls told to remove bras at NEET centre
36.article_body: A protest was held on Wednesday outside the NEET exam centre where female students had allegedly been told to take off their bras before taking the exam. Protesters, purportedly belonging to Kerala BJP, were seen carrying BJP flags outside Mar Thoma Institute of Information Technology. Earlier, a student's parent filed a complaint about the removal of innerwear with Kollam SP.

37.title: No forced child labour cases during lockdown: Centre
37.article_body: The Rajya Sabha was informed that there were no cases of children who were forced to leave their homes for illegal child labour during the lockdown reported to child rights body NCPCR. Union Minister Smriti Irani said that 330 railway stations have been equipped with CCTVs and monitoring rooms. NCPCR has received 617 child kidnapping complaints since 2020.

38.title: 2012 batch IAS officer K Srinivas appointed Bengaluru Urban DC
38.article_body: K Srinivas, a 2012 batch IAS officer, has taken charge as Bengaluru Urban district deputy commissioner. The post fell vacant after incumbent J Manjunath was arrested earlier this month for allegedly taking ₹5 lakh bribe. The deputy commissioner's position is quasi-judicial with powers to resolve land disputes and issue no-objection certificates.

39.title: Suspects who set on fire Lankan Prez's home sent to judicial custody
39.article_body: The four suspects who allegedly set ablaze the residence of Sri Lanka's newly-elected President Ranil Wickremesinghe in Colombo have been sent to judicial custody till July 27. The suspects were arrested on July 10 and will be produced for identification parade on July 27. Wickremesinghe said the July 9 fire had destroyed over 4,000 books and his 125-year-old piano.

40.title: BJP govt in UP invoking NSA even in trivial cases: BSP chief
40.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Wednesday said the BJP government in Uttar Pradesh was invoking National Security Act (NSA) even in trivial cases, in order to cover up its failure to control crime. "Criminals associated with the ruling party are roaming freely," Mayawati said. "In such a situation, how can rule of law be established in the state?" she added.

41.title: Water purifier firm DrinkPrime raises ₹60 crore in Series A round
41.article_body: Water purifier subscription company DrinkPrime has raised ₹60 crore in its Series A funding round. The round saw participation from Omidyar Network India, Surge Sequoia and 9Unicorns. According to its Co-founder and Chief Executive Officer Vijender Reddy Muthyala, the company's goal is to make safe drinking water accessible to the majority of India.

42.title: Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande meets Bangladesh PM
42.article_body: Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande paid a visit to Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina at the latter's residence in Dhaka. The Indian Army chief is on a three-day visit to Bangladesh at the invitation of his counterpart General SM Shafiuddin Ahmed. General Pande is being accompanied by a three-member delegation and his wife Archana Pande.

43.title: Roads melt into sticky, black goo amid record-breaking temperatures in UK, pics surface
43.article_body: Several roads in the UK melted into a sticky, black goo amid record-breaking heatwave in the UK. A local in Manchester said that it looked like cars were "driving through water". "It was that soft your feet got stuck in it if you walked across. The tarmac was all stuck in the treads of my tyres," the local stated.

44.title: Cong showing destructive attitude towards democracy: Union Minister
44.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Wednesday criticised Congress for disrupting proceedings in the Parliament. He added that the government is not running away from debate on price rise and such issues can be taken up once Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman recovers from COVID-19. He alleged there was a competition among Opposition parties on who would disrupt Parliament the most.

45.title: Mexican beauty queen, accomplice held for $1.7mn wine theft in Europe
45.article_body: An ex-Mexican beauty pageant contestant and a Romanian-Dutch accomplice have been arrested in Croatia over theft of $1.7 million worth of bottles of wine after nine-month chase across Europe. The accused reportedly stole 45 vintage wine bottles from a hotel in Spain. Spanish authorities worked with counterparts in Netherlands, Croatia and Romania to catch the pair, who haven't been identified.

46.title: 3 men die of electrocution in TN, CM announces ₹2 lakh ex-gratia
46.article_body: Three men, aged between 40-45 years, died of electrocution in Tamil Nadu's Viluppuram district, after coming in contact with an electric fence put up in a farm area. The fence was reportedly put up by a farmer to tackle the menace of wild boars. CM MK Stalin ordered an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh to each of the three families.

47.title: UN accuses Taliban of extrajudicial killings & torture since takeover
47.article_body: The UN in a report on Wednesday accused the Taliban of extrajudicial killings, torture, arbitrary arrests and inhumane punishments since their takeover last year. The violations were targeted at a number of groups, including former government officials, human rights defenders and journalists, the report said. However, a spokesman for the Taliban government rejected the report's findings.

48.title: Italian PM Draghi to stay in office if allies recommit to unity
48.article_body: Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi on Wednesday said he would rescind his resignation offer if his coalition partners recommit to unity. Last week, Draghi offered to resign after senators of ally 5-Star Movement boycotted a confidence vote. In recent days, citizens from all corners have urged Draghi to stay in office as Italy battles soaring inflation.

49.title: Heatwaves to become more frequent, will continue till 2060s: UN
49.article_body: Amid heatwaves in Europe, UN said that heatwaves will become more frequent and are likely to continue until 2060s irrespective of climate mitigation efforts. "Emissions are still growing...especially in...big Asian countries which are...largest emitters," UN's World Meteorological Organization chief said. Notably, UK reported its hottest day on July 19 as temperatures crossed 40°C for first time.

50.title: Sri Lanka seeks UK intelligence help in Easter Sunday attack probe
50.article_body: Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was elected Sri Lanka's President on Wednesday, has sought the assistance of the British intelligence services to complete the probe of the Easter Sunday suicide attacks in 2019. Wickremesinghe said the absence of proper investigation of the attacks meant the issue was not yet resolved. The suicide attacks had killed nearly 270 people in the island nation.

51.title: MVA govt didn't implement schemes for minorities properly: Maha SP
51.article_body: The Maharashtra unit of Samajwadi Party on Wednesday criticised the previous Maha Vikas Aghadi government and said it failed to implement important schemes of the minority ministry properly. "We've evaluated the performance of...schemes...being run by the state Minority Department," SP MLA Rais Shaikh said. "In nearly 19 of them, the utilisation of funds is less than 50%," he added.

52.title: RPF seized drugs worth ₹40.58 cr from 2019 to 2021; arrested 1,108: Govt
52.article_body: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) recovered narcotics worth ₹40.58 crore in the last three years, Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said. In a written reply to a question in Lok Sabha, he said between 2019 and 2021, the RPF registered 1,262 cases related to narcotics and arrested 1,108 people. The seized narcotics were handed over to the agencies empowered to investigate.

53.title: Man, his 66-yr-old grandmother stabbed in Delhi after row with 2 men
53.article_body: A 22-year-old man and his 66-year-old grandmother were allegedly stabbed in South Delhi's Mehrauli. The youth said two men were shouting and using abusive language near his house on Tuesday, following which his grandmother asked them to leave the place. Thereafter, a scuffle took place between them and the men later came with their associates to attack them, he added.

54.title: Turkish airstrikes kill 8 in Iraq, over 20 injured
54.article_body: Airstrikes by Turkey killed eight tourists and wounded over a dozen people in northern Iraq on Wednesday, Iraqi Kurdish officials said. The semi-autonomous Kurdish-run district of Zakho was targeted in the attack. The Kurdistan Worker's Party has led insurgency in southeast Turkey since 1984 and is listed as a terrorist organisation by Turkey, the United States and the European Union.

55.title: Cong not letting DK Shivakumar function as KPCC President: K'taka CM
55.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday criticised Congress and said the party is not letting DK Shivakumar function as KPCC President. "Shivakumar has been nursing the dream of becoming the CM...We've been watching what is happening in Congress," Bommai said. This comes after DK Shivakumar on Tuesday said Congress coming to power was more important than him becoming the CM.

56.title: 9.8 lakh posts vacant in central govt departments as on Mar 1, 2021: Govt
56.article_body: Nearly 9.8 lakh posts in central government departments were vacant as of March 1, 2021, Union Minister of State Jitendra Singh informed the Lok Sabha on Wednesday. Of the 40,35,203 sanctioned posts, 30,55,876 were filled, Singh said. "All ministries/departments of...central government have been requested to take action in a mission mode for filling up of vacant posts," he added.

57.title: Ukraine asks international creditors to freeze debt payment amid war
57.article_body: Ukraine has asked its international creditors to freeze its debt payments for two years due to the ongoing war with Russia. The Ukrainian Finance Ministry on Wednesday said that it was hoping to finalise the deferral on its roughly $20 billion of debt by August 9. Notably, Ukraine plans to offer lenders additional interest payments once the freeze ends.

58.title: EU publishes emergency plan in case Russia cuts off gas supply
58.article_body: The European Commission on Wednesday published emergency plan to immediately decrease gas demand in the European Union countries as fear of Russia cutting off supplies looms ahead of winter. Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen said Russia was "using energy as a weapon" amidst the Ukraine war. The emergency plan asks all EU members to reduce gas demand by 15%.

59.title: Nearly 4 lakh Indians gave up citizenship between 2019-2021: Govt
59.article_body: Over 3.9 lakh Indians renounced their citizenship between 2019-2021 with the US emerging as the most preferred choice, the Ministry of Home Affairs said. According to the ministry, 1,400 people moved to China and 48 people moved to Pakistan in the same period. In the last year, 78,000 Indians renounced their citizenship to move to the US.

60.title: Fintech startup Slice shifts to term loans after RBI directive
60.article_body: Fintech startup Slice is changing its lending model and will now offer real-time term loans to customers for each transaction. This moves from its previous model where Slice offered a pre-approved credit line to customers to use as per their discretion. This comes after an RBI mandate prohibited loading credit lines into prepaid payment instruments like wallets and prepaid cards.

61.title: Nepal civic group urges govt to reclaim land encroached by China
61.article_body: A civic group in Nepal on Tuesday submitted a memorandum to the Nepalese government, urging it to reclaim country's territory occupied by China. "The encroachment in various areas of...Nepal-China border, including Ruila...is...a direct challenge to the sovereignty of Nepal," the memorandum read. Nepal and China reportedly have territorial disputes in districts of Humla, Gorkha and Sankhuwasabha.

62.title: Scindia shares video of India's 1st pilot-less passenger-carrying drone 'Varuna'
62.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia took to Twitter to share a video of India's first pilot-less passenger-carrying drone 'Varuna'. "Drones now will not just be only cargo carriers but also human carriers!" he wrote. He further said that 'Varuna' can carry weight of 130 kg and travel 25 km at a time.

63.title: Healthtech startup Fitterfly raises $12 mn in Series A funding
63.article_body: Mumbai-based healthtech startup Fitterfly has raised $12 million in a Series A funding round. Led by Amazon Smbhav Venture Fund and Fireside Ventures, the round saw participation from 9 Unicorns, Venture Catalysts, Nihar Parikh of 4point0 Health Ventures, and Sriram Natarajan of Molbio. The startup, founded in 2016 by Dr Arbinder Singal and Shailesh Gupta, has over 200 employees.

64.title: Automation platform AppViewX raises $20 mn in Series B round
64.article_body: Seattle-based automation startup, AppViewX, raised $20 million in a Series B funding round led by existing investor Brighton Park Capital. The startup has also announced that it will be inaugurating its 100-seater global centre of excellence in Bengaluru. The firm will use the capital to maximise its go-to-market operations and product development and overall revenue growth strategies.

65.title: Alt News Co-founder Zubair released from jail 24 days after arrest
65.article_body: Fact-checker and Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair was released from Delhi's Tihar Jail on Wednesday, 24 days after he was arrested over a 2018 tweet. Earlier in the day, the Supreme Court granted interim bail to Zubair in all six FIRs registered against him in Uttar Pradesh. The court had ordered his release at 6 pm on Wednesday.

66.title: Syria breaks diplomatic ties with Ukraine in reciprocal measure
66.article_body: Syria on Wednesday formally broke diplomatic relations with Ukraine in response to a similar move by Ukraine days earlier. Syria, which is a close ally of Russia, recognised two Ukrainian separatist regions of Donetsk and Luhansk as independent last month, following which Ukraine broke ties with the country. Russia had recognised these regions as independent before invading Ukraine.

67.title: 118 civilians killed in J&K since August 2019: Centre
67.article_body: Since the abrogation of Article 370 in 2019, 118 civilians have been killed in Jammu and Kashmir including five Kashmiri Pandits and 16 other Hindus and Sikhs. Union Minister of State Nityanand Rai said that no Pandit has migrated from J&K since August 2019. He added that there has been a decline in the number of terror attacks since 2018.

68.title: Rainbow coloured pic of Pluto shared by NASA, social media users react
68.article_body: NASA shared a translated colour image of Pluto, created by New Horizons scientists to highlight colour differences between its distinct regions. "Pluto has a complex...surface with jumbled mountains, carved-out valleys, old, heavily cratered terrain sitting right next to...icy plains," wrote NASA. "Pluto is where the party's at," a comment read while another person wrote, "This is so beautiful!"

69.title: 5 arrested for allegedly torching UP building in 1984 anti-Sikh riots
69.article_body: A Special Investigation Team on Wednesday arrested five men who are accused of setting a building on fire in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur in the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. Three people had been burnt to death in the fire. The arrested men, all residents of Kidwai Nagar, have been identified as Anil Kumar Pandey, Sriram, Mustaqeem, Abdul Waheed and Irshad Khan.

70.title: OnePlus to launch OnePlus 10T 5G and OxygenOS 13 on August 3
70.article_body: OnePlus announced that its second flagship smartphone of 2022, the OnePlus 10T 5G along with the all new OxygenOS 13 will be launched in New York City on August 3. The OnePlus 10T is powered by the Snapdragon®️ 8+ Gen 1 Mobile Platform, while OxygenOS 13 comes with refreshed design, AODs, Zen Mode and enhanced gaming, connectivity, and safety.

71.title: Xiaomi India launches Redmi K50i 5G smartphone & Redmi Earbuds 3 Lite
71.article_body: Xiaomi India has launched Redmi K50i 5G, starting at ₹25,999. The ultimate 'India-ready 5G' phone comes with flagship MediaTek Dimensity 8100 chipset, 144Hz 7-stage AdaptiveSync FFS Display, triple-camera setup, 5080mAh battery, 67W in-box turbocharger, Dolby Vision™️ & Dolby Atmos®️ certification, the brand stated. Available on mi.com & Amazon.in, Xiaomi also launched Redmi Buds 3 Lite at ₹1,999.

72.title: UP Minister Dinesh Khatik resigns, says 'was sidelined because I am a Dalit'
72.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister of State for Jal Shakti Dinesh Khatik on Wednesday resigned from his post alleging that he was sidelined because he is a Dalit. He sent his resignation letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah instead of CM Yogi Adityanath. "My working as a minister of state is... waste for the Dalit community," Khatik said in the letter.

73.title: 13 lakh electric vehicles registered in country: Nitin Gadkari
73.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Wednesday informed the Rajya Sabha that over 13 lakh electric vehicles are registered in the country. However, the number excludes data from Andhra Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Telangana and Lakshadweep. Under Faster Adoption and Manufacturing of Electric Vehicles (FAME) Phase-II scheme, 2,877 public EV charging stations have been sanctioned in 68 cities, Gadkari said.

74.title: Door-to-door checking done: Haryana Home Minister on DSP's killing
74.article_body: A day after DSP Surender Singh was killed by mining mafia in Haryana's Nuh, Home Minister Anil Vij said door-to-door checking was done to arrest the accused. "We're investigating the matter. We're taking strict measures to ensure law and order in the state," he said. The accused truck driver was arrested from Rajasthan's Bharatpur, Anil Vij said.

75.title: Delhi HC allows minor rape victim to terminate 26-week pregnancy
75.article_body: Delhi HC has allowed a minor rape victim to undergo medical termination of her 26-week pregnancy, saying her misery would stand compounded if she was forced to become a mother at a tender age. Forcing the victim to go through the pregnancy would scar her psyche, the Court observed. It also directed hospital to preserve terminal foetus for DNA testing.

76.title: Rishi Sunak among final 2 contenders for UK PM, wins most votes in latest voting round
76.article_body: Former British Finance Minister Rishi Sunak and Foreign Secretary Liz Truss on Wednesday made it through to final stage of the leadership contest to replace Prime Minister Boris Johnson. Sunak won the fifth voting round of Tory MPs with 137 votes, while second-placed Truss won the support of 113 MPs. Former Defence Secretary Penny Mordaunt was eliminated with 105 votes.

77.title: Hope Pant takes care of his weight; he can emerge as a model, earn in crores: Akhtar
77.article_body: Former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has said that Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant is a little overweight. He added, "I hope he takes care of that. Because India's market is big. He's good-looking. He can emerge as a model, earn in crores." Akhtar further said, "In times to come, Rishabh Pant is going to be a superstar."

78.title: TRS workers protest against GST on packaged milk, dairy products
78.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) leaders and workers took to the streets across the state on Wednesday to protest against the Centre's decision to impose Goods and Services Tax (GST) on packaged milk and dairy products. "The party condemns the anti-people policies of the Centre and will continue to resist till a rollback is announced," TRS MLA Danam Nagender said.

79.title: 472 kg marijuana worth ₹47 lakh seized in Assam's Karimganj, 1 held
79.article_body:
Police on Tuesday night seized 472 kg of marijuana worth ₹47 lakh from a truck in Karimganj district along the Assam-Tripura border and arrested one person in connection with the case. 
"The truck was coming from Tripura side...We apprehended the truck driver identified as Sajala Debbarman," Niranjan Das, in-charge of Churaibari police watch post, said.

80.title: J&K makes face masks, social distancing mandatory amid COVID surge
80.article_body: As COVID-19 cases spike in Jammu and Kashmir, wearing masks and social distancing have been made mandatory in all public places including colleges, schools, markets, multiplexes and banks. The Deputy Commissioner of Jammu issued a circular stating that officials must ensure that all preventive measures are implemented. Jammu and Kashmir reported 333 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

81.title: Police kills arms smuggler in encounter in Assam
81.article_body: An arms smuggler named Adam Ali was killed in an encounter with Assam Police on Tuesday. Police had launched a search operation on Tuesday in Dhubri, where Ali had taken shelter. "When the police team reached the area...Ali fired and the police team retaliated," SP Abhijit Gurav said. "[Ali] was involved in anti-national activity, Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen...arms smuggling [and] hawala," he added.

82.title: Wipro's net profit falls 21% YoY to ₹2,564 cr in Q1, revenue up 16%
82.article_body: Wipro Limited on Wednesday reported a 20.93% YoY decline in its consolidated profit after tax to ₹2,563.6 crore for the March-June quarter. The company's consolidated revenue, however, rose 15.51% YoY to ₹22,001 crore in Q1 FY23, up from ₹19,045 crore in Q1 FY22. "At 15% of operating margins, we believe that we have bottomed out," said Wipro CFO Jatin Dalal.

83.title: Truck driver who ran over DSP amid mining raid in Haryana arrested from Rajasthan
83.article_body: Haryana Police on Wednesday arrested the truck driver who allegedly ran over DSP Surender Singh during an illegal mining check in Nuh a day ago. The accused named Mittar was nabbed from Rajasthan's Bharatpur, Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij said. The DSP had signalled a stone-laden truck to slow down, but the driver instead sped up and ran him over.

84.title: 4 dead as ambulance carrying patient crashes at K'taka toll booth, incident caught on CCTV
84.article_body: An ambulance carrying a patient and two attendants lost control and crashed into a toll booth in Karnataka's Udupi district today, killing all three and a toll attendant. The driver was injured, police said. In the video footage, some men who appear to be toll operators can be seen scurrying to remove three plastic barricades on seeing the ambulance approach.

85.title: 742 kms of metro rail lines operational in 19 cities: Govt report
85.article_body: Nearly 742 kilometres of metro rail lines are operational in 19 cities across the country, according to a parliamentary panel report. About 1,037 kilometres of metro rail lines are being laid in 27 cities, the report said. Cities like Varanasi, Thiruvananthapuram, Kozhikode, Guwahati and Chandigarh are aspiring to have a metro rail system, the report added.

86.title: 2 dead, 2,642 held from rly premises over Agnipath protests: Govt
86.article_body: Two people died, 35 were injured and 2,642 were arrested from railway premises during the protests against the Agnipath scheme, Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw informed the Parliament on Wednesday. The minister said because of strikes and agitations, the railways has incurred a loss of ₹151 crore in 2019-20, ₹904 crore in 2020-21 and ₹62 crore in 2021-22.

87.title: Hope to complete Sri Lanka aid talks as soon as possible: IMF chief
87.article_body: International Monetary Fund (IMF) hopes to complete negotiations with Sri Lanka on a bailout package "as quickly as possible", IMF MD Kristalina Georgieva said. "The moment there is a government [in Sri Lanka], we can continue our discussions and our team will be there," Georgieva said. Sri Lanka needs about $5 billion in next six months to cover basic necessities.

88.title: Which are the world's most peaceful countries as India is ranked 135th?
88.article_body: As per the recently released Global Peace Index (GPI) 2022, which ranks 163 of the world's nations in terms of 'peacefulness', India has been ranked 135th. Iceland has been named the most peaceful country, while New Zealand has been ranked the second-most peaceful country. New Zealand is followed by Ireland, Denmark, Austria, Portugal, Slovenia, Czech Republic and Singapore.

89.title: SC to hear AAP's plea against postponement of MCD polls on July 26
89.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said it will hear on July 26 the Aam Aadmi Party's plea challenging the postponement of Municipal Corporations of Delhi elections. The AAP's representative said the three municipal corporations in Delhi have been unified and their terms expired in May this year. Delimitation shouldn't be the sole reason to postpone the polls, the AAP contended.

90.title: Govt shares state-wise list of employment generated by DPIIT-recognised startups
90.article_body: The government told Lok Sabha that Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT)-recognised startups have generated nearly 7.68 lakh jobs since Startup India initiative was launched in 2016. As per a list, such startups in Maharashtra created 1.46 lakh jobs, followed by Karnataka (1.03 lakh jobs) and Delhi (87,643 jobs). Uttar Pradesh came fourth with 67,694 jobs.

91.title: B'desh PM invites Mamata to visit newly-constructed Padma Bridge
91.article_body: Bangladeshi PM Sheikh Hasina has invited West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee to come and see the newly-constructed Padma Bridge there. "This bridge is expected to strengthen bilateral ties between Bangladesh and West Bengal, or rather entire India and open up new avenues for bilateral trade," Hasina wrote in a letter to Banerjee. Notably, the 6.51-km-long bridge is Bangladesh's longest bridge.

92.title: Ex-K'taka minister Eshwarappa cleared of all charges in contractor suicide case
92.article_body: Former Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa was on Wednesday cleared of all charges by the police in connection with the alleged suicide of civil contractor Santosh Patil in April this year. In WhatsApp messages to his friends and the media, Patil had blamed Eshwarappa for his death. Recently, Patil's wife wrote to the Governor seeking a transparent investigation into the case.

93.title: Poor quality water being consumed in parts of Bengaluru
93.article_body: Poor quality water is being consumed in parts of Bengaluru with total dissolved solids and water hardness levels exceeding permissible limits in Electronic City, HSR Layout and Whitefield areas, according to a recent study. High TDS levels in water can cause nausea, lung irritation, among other health problems. The study used water samples taken between January and May this year.

94.title: NIA conducts raid in Madrasa, arrests teacher in Bihar
94.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) conducted a raid in Jamia Maria Niswa Madrasa and arrested a teacher named Asghar Ali in Bihar's Purvi Champaran district. NIA also recovered five bags full of books from Ali's house. This comes after police busted a potential terror module in Bihar and arrested accused with links to Islamic extremist outfit Popular Front of India (PFI).

95.title: Woman's body found stuffed inside iron box in Punjab, husband held
95.article_body: The Punjab Police on Tuesday arrested a man for the alleged murder of his wife after her body was found hidden inside a box in Ludhiana. ASI Satpal Singh said the woman's family, after not being able to reach the couple, reached their house. They checked the rooms and found the deceased's body inside an iron box, Singh added.

96.title: Govt approves 6,000 transit shelters for Kashmiri migrants in J&K
96.article_body: Centre has approved construction of 6,000 transit shelters for Kashmiri migrants employed in the valley under a special package of the prime minister, Union Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai told Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. "Construction of 1,025 units has been completed or substantially completed," he added. Rai also said the government has acquired land for various public purposes.

97.title: B'luru woman with heart issue airlifted from US to Chennai in 26 hrs
97.article_body: A 67-year-old woman with a critical heart condition was airlifted from Portland in the United States to Chennai in a 26-hour long flight, becoming one of the longest aero-medical evacuations to India. The airlift cost the family $133,000 (a little over ₹1 crore), reports said. The woman was transported to Chennai in two separate private jets, reports added.

98.title: Faridabad Police arrests 5 for cheating 335 on pretext of giving jobs
98.article_body: Faridabad Police on Sunday arrested five men for allegedly duping 335 people across the country on the pretext of providing them with jobs. The accused would contact job seekers by posing as recruiters and ask them to deposit various fees after conducting job interviews, according to the police. The police have recovered ₹3.97 lakh from the accused.

99.title: 'Pad Man' producer Prerna Arora charged with money laundering in alleged fraud of ₹31cr
99.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has registered a case of money laundering against producer Prerna Arora, known for producing films including 'Pad Man' and 'Toilet - Ek Prem Katha'. Prerna allegedly faces fraud charges of ₹31 crore. ED summoned her today but she didn't appear as she's not in Mumbai. On her behalf, her lawyer reached the ED office and sought time.

100.title: Girl with rare condition undergoes surgery in Delhi to fix spine curvature
100.article_body: A 12-year-old girl from Kyrgyzstan with an extremely deformed spine underwent surgery at a private hospital in Delhi that reduced her spine curvature from 130 degrees to 30 degrees, according to a statement. The girl suffers from Progressive Dorsolumbar Scoliosis, a rare condition that affects about three children out of every one lakh.

101.title: 2 killed, 8 injured as under-construction bridge collapses in U'khand
101.article_body: Two labourers were killed and eight were injured after an under-construction bridge collapsed on Rishikesh-Badrinath highway in Uttarakhand on Wednesday morning, the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) said. "Two people died on the spot," SDRF spokesperson said. Rudraprayag DM, who visited the spot along with the officials concerned, said a high-level probe will be conducted into the matter.

102.title: Armed gunmen shoot 29 dogs dead in Qatar, injure many others
102.article_body: A group of armed gunmen stormed a secure factory area in Qatar and shot 29 dogs dead and injured many others. The gunmen claimed they shot dogs dead because a dog had bitten the son of a gunman, Doha-based animal rescue charity Paws Rescue Qatar said. "I'm genuinely shocked," a social media user commented, while another wrote, "It's barbaric."

103.title: Virat Kohli & Rohit Sharma drop in latest rankings for ODI batters, Pant jumps 25 places
103.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday announced the latest rankings for ODI batters. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma dropped down one place each to be ranked fourth and fifth, respectively. Meanwhile, Rishabh Pant, who slammed his maiden ODI hundred in the third ODI against England, jumped 25 places to be ranked 52nd. Further, Hardik Pandya jumped eight places to be ranked 42nd.

104.title: PMC to levy value-based property tax on 100 properties on pilot basis
104.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will levy value-based property tax on 100 properties on a pilot basis. This is being done in an attempt to bridge the gap in the amount of property tax levied on old and new properties. Currently, property tax is levied as per the ready reckoner rate of the year of the concerned property's registration.

105.title: Maha CM Eknath Shinde stakes claim over Shiv Sena, sends letter to EC
105.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday night approached the Election Commission of India (ECI), staking claim over the Shiv Sena. CM Shinde on Tuesday said Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has recognised rebel Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale as the party's floor leader in the Lower House of Parliament. Sanjay Raut on Tuesday called Shinde's faction "snakes".

106.title: 7 flights diverted, 40 delayed at Delhi airport after heavy rainfall
106.article_body: As heavy rains lashed Delhi on Wednesday, as many as seven flights were diverted and 40 were delayed at Delhi airport, as per reports. Vistara said its two Mumbai-Delhi flights were diverted to Jaipur and Indore due to heavy rainfall. Many parts of Delhi were waterlogged and traffic was affected in many areas after the rainfall.

107.title: PM Modi meets PT Usha after she takes oath in Parliament, shares pic
107.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met renowned former athlete PT Usha in Parliament after the latter took oath as Rajya Sabha MP on Wednesday. The Prime Minister shared a picture of him standing beside Usha on Twitter. He tweeted, "Glad to have met PT Usha ji in Parliament." Usha, 58, has won 18 gold medals for India at several international events.

108.title: Cheetahs to return to Indian forests for 1st time in nearly 70 yrs
108.article_body: India and Namibia on Wednesday signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to reintroduce cheetahs in the country after nearly seven decades. As per the agreement with Namibia, India will get eight cheetahs in two batches of four. MP's Kuno National Park is likely to receive the first tranche of cheetahs by August 15.

109.title: Hand over AIADMK headquarter keys to EPS: Madras HC to Tamil Nadu govt
109.article_body: The Madras High Court on Wednesday asked the Tamil Nadu government to hand over keys of AIADMK headquarters to Interim General Secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami, also known as EPS. The court asked AIADMK cadres not to enter the office for one month to prevent untoward incidents. The office was sealed after a clash between supporters of EPS and O Panneerselvam.

110.title: Be fair: AAP MP urges Centre to give representation to Punjab in MSP panel
110.article_body: AAP MP Vikramjit Singh Sahney on Wednesday urged the Centre to "be fair" and include representatives from Punjab in the committee constituted on the minimum support price (MSP) along with the Commission for Agricultural Costs & Prices (CACP). Avoiding a dialogue with representatives of Punjab will not serve the purpose, Sahney said.

111.title: National Lok Adalat to be held in Noida on August 13
111.article_body: A National Lok Adalat will be organised in Noida on August 13, the district administration said on Tuesday. District Magistrate Suhas LY said that various cases, including criminal compoundable suit, family disputes and water bill payment disputes, will be adjudicated by the Lok Adalat. He also called upon people to turn out in large numbers and avail of this opportunity.

112.title: Gang of inter-state contract killers arrested for murder in Hyderabad
112.article_body: Four inter-state contract killers, who executed the murder of a businessman on the outskirts of Hyderabad five days ago, were arrested, the Rachakonda Police tweeted. Police said the accused killed a businessman, Ambati Raghupathi, for ₹30 lakh on July 15 at Dammaiguda. The prime accused in the case, 33-year-old Srikanth Reddy, was also arrested by the police.

113.title: EAM Jaishankar to address UNGA session in September
113.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will address the annual UN General Assembly session on September 24, according to the UN's provisional list of speakers. The General Debate of the 77th Session of the UNGA will be held from September 20 to 26. The Russia-Ukraine war and the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic are expected to be discussed at the annual meet.

114.title: CWG 2022-bound Indian athletes Dhanalakshmi, Aishwarya Babu fail dope test: Reports
114.article_body: Commonwealth Games 2022-bound athletes Dhanalakshmi and Aishwarya Babu have failed dope test, as per reports. Sprinter Dhanalakshmi returned positive for a banned steroid, while Aishwarya returned positive for a banned substance after NADA officials took her sample during National Inter-State Athletics Championships last month. Aishwarya had broken the triple jump national record during the meet.

115.title: Satisfy hunger with tadka of jumlas: Rahul on GST on essential items
115.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi over GST on packaged food items and said that PM will have to take back the move. "Recipe of Gabbar for people struggling with inflation: Make less, eat less, satisfy hunger with the tadka of jumlas," he said. Packaged food weighing less than 25kg will carry 5% GST.

116.title: Odisha STF seizes leopard skin, 1 arrested
116.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of Odisha Police seized a leopard skin and arrested one person on charges of smuggling in Koraput, officials said on Wednesday. Based on a tip-off, a team of STF conducted a raid with the help of Ramgir Forest Officials near Ramgir Gupteswar Gate. Since 2020, the STF has arrested 43 wildlife criminals, an official said.

117.title: B'luru Police rescue boy within 3 hours of his abduction; 4 held
117.article_body: Bengaluru Police on Tuesday rescued a 19-year-old college student within three hours of his abduction and arrested four of the alleged perpetrators, with assistance from the Chitradurga Police. The vehicle carrying the abducted teen, Jagadish, was tracked down by the police using FASTag details. Jagadish was abducted as his father owed one of the accused around ₹3 crore, probe found.

118.title: Venture capital firm First Cheque closes second fund at $5 mn
118.article_body: Early-stage venture capital firm First Cheque has raised $5 million from global investors for its second fund. Before the fund was launched, First Cheque operated as an AngelList Syndicate and invested in more than 100 startups in the last three years. The firm is looking to back first-time founders and will invest $100,000 in each of its portfolio companies.

119.title: Agritech startup Growcoms raises $1 mn in pre-Series A fund
119.article_body: Kochi-based agritech startup, Growcoms, has raised $1 million in its pre-Series A funding round led by Info Edge. The firm, supported by Kerala Startup Mission and incubated in Indigram Labs Foundation, was founded in 2021 by George Kurian Kannanthanam, Bibin Mathews and Narendranath P. The firm focuses on making farmers aware about enhancing the quality of produce, said Co-founder Kannanthanam.

120.title: Follow ringmaster US Federal Reserve to save local currency: Uday Kotak
120.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank CEO Uday Kotak on Tuesday said central banks which don't follow "ringmaster US Federal Reserve" have their local currencies crushed. "Look at Japan, a 30%+ depreciation. That's the power of the US $," Kotak tweeted. He added that central banks globally take a cue from the US Federal Reserve and decide their monetary policies accordingly.

121.title: Kolkata residents allege air pollution due to cats; NGT forms panel
121.article_body: Residents of an apartment in Kolkata have alleged that droppings, hair and dander of cats kept by a flat owner were causing air pollution. National Green Tribunal has formed a three-member panel to look into the matter. The residents said that the flat owner has 20 to 25 cats and she feeds 15 to 20 stray cats in the corridor.

122.title: HC orders handing of AIADMK headquarters' keys to Palaniswami
122.article_body: Madras High Court on Wednesday ordered to hand over the keys of AIADMK headquarters to current AIADMK Interim General Secretary Edappadi Palaniswami. The court stated that the party cadres or workers are not allowed to enter the headquarters for a month. The headquarters, 'MGR Maaligai', was sealed earlier this month after violence erupted between supporters of Palaniswami and O Panneerselvam.

123.title: 4 Delhi women arrested with 6.5 kg cannabis; search on to nab supplier
123.article_body: Delhi Police's Anti-Narcotics Cell arrested four women drug peddlers near Najafgarh's Anaj Mandi and recovered 6.5 kg cannabis from their possession during a raid, an official said on Wednesday. Based on a tip-off that women sell drugs at Indira market, a trap was laid to arrest them. According to police, search is on to arrest the main supplier of drugs.

124.title: A company has asked me to donate sperm to create more Elon Musks: Musk's father
124.article_body: Elon Musk's father Errol has claimed he has been asked by a company in Colombia "to donate sperm to impregnate women and create a new generation of Elon Musks". "They haven't offered me any money but they have offered me first-class travel and five-star hotel accommodation and all that sort of stuff," the 76-year-old told The Sun.

125.title: BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri booked for allegedly abusing T'gana CM
125.article_body: BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri was booked on Wednesday for allegedly abusing Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao. Arvind, who made the alleged comments at an event in Hyderabad last week, was accused of degrading the CM's image and inciting hate towards the state government in the FIR. Notably, Arvind recently alleged that his convoy was attacked by TRS workers.

126.title: NCP workers float paper boats in potholes at Pune's Swargate junction
126.article_body: NCP workers floated paper boats in potholes at the Swargate junction in Pune to mark a protest on Wednesday. This comes a day after the Pune Municipal Corporation said that 90% of potholes on city roads had been repaired from July 15 to 18. The party workers said BJP was responsible for the bad state of the roads.

127.title: 2 gangsters involved in Sidhu Moosewala's murder case killed in encounter
127.article_body: Two gangsters involved in singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder case, namely Jagroop Singh Roopa and Manpreet Singh, were killed in a shootout with the police in Amritsar today, said Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav. He confirmed that three policemen also suffered minor injuries. "We have recovered an AK47 and a pistol," Punjab DGP further stated.

128.title: Barca only club to have no money but buy every player: Bayern's Nagelsmann
128.article_body: Following Bayern Munich striker Robert Lewandowski's transfer to Barcelona, Bayern Munich manager Julian Nagelsmann said, "Barcelona [are] the only club that [have] no money but then...[buy] every player they want." "I do not know how [they do it]. It is kind of weird...crazy," added Nagelsmann. Barcelona President Joan Laporta Estruch had recently said the club is in the "ICU" financially.

129.title: Pak record highest successful run chase at Galle Stadium in Test win vs SL
129.article_body: Pakistan recorded the highest successful run chase in Test cricket at the Galle International Stadium as they defeated Sri Lanka by four wickets. Pakistan chased down a target of 342 runs to win the match and take a 1-0 lead in the two-Test series. The previous highest successful fourth-innings chase was 268 by Sri Lanka versus New Zealand in 2019.

130.title: 58% of total work of Mumbai Coastal Road Project completed: BMC
130.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday confirmed that 58% of the total work of the Mumbai Coastal Road Project (South) has been completed. The reclamation of 107 hectares out of the total 111 hectares that constitute 97% of the project has been completed. Moreover, 70% of work on the sea wall has also been finished.

131.title: Homes, hospital evacuated as wildfire rages near Athens
131.article_body: Hundreds of people were evacuated from their homes as firefighters on Wednesday battled a wildfire that raged for a second day in the mountains near Athens. The wildfire also prompted authorities to evacuate a hospital. About 485 firefighters and 120 fire engines have been deployed to contain the blaze, which has destroyed a number of homes and businesses.

132.title: Could not find spark with the ball: Buttler on defeat against SA
132.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler said they couldn't find the spark with the ball in their defeat against South Africa on Tuesday. "It was a fantastic partnership between Rassie van der Dussen and Aiden Markram and we were not able to break that," he stated. South Africa posted 333/5 and then bundled out England for 271 to win the first ODI.

133.title: Hardik got a good shock when he was out of team for 1-2 yrs: Akhtar
133.article_body: Shoaib Akhtar said Hardik Pandya got a "good shock" when he was out of the team for one-two years as he was unfit and casual. "He's become serious about his fitness," added Akhtar. Talking about Rishabh Pant, Akhtar stated, "My advice...would be to improve his physique...He is a little overweight." "He's good-looking...[and] can emerge as a model, earn in crores."

134.title: World chess champion Magnus Carlsen to give up his title
134.article_body: World number one chess player Magnus Carlsen, who's the defending world chess champion, said that he'll not defend his world championship title in 2023. "I am not motivated to play another match. I simply feel that I don't have a lot to gain," he said. "It didn't mean anything to me," he added, talking about defending the title in 2021.

135.title: Resigning only way when not respected: Akhilesh on UP minister's resignation
135.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav shared his take on the resignation of BJP MLA Dinesh Khatik, who alleged that the Yogi government sidelined him as he is a Dalit. "Where you are not respected as a minister but insulted because you're a Dalit, resigning from such a discriminatory BJP government is the only way," he tweeted in Hindi.

136.title: Putin's Iran trip shows how isolated Russia has become: US
136.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's trip to Iran shows how Russia has become isolated amid the Ukraine war, US National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said. Putin arrived in Tehran on Tuesday and held talks with Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and President Ebrahim Raisi. This is Putin's second trip abroad since Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

137.title: Vikram Bhatt's romance with Sushmita started during 'Dastak' making in Seychelles: Mahesh
137.article_body: Mahesh Bhatt, coming out in support of Sushmita Sen who recently announced she's dating Lalit Modi, also shared how she met her former partner Vikram Bhatt. "During the making of 'Dastak', Vikram's romance with Sushmita started in Seychelles," he stated. "Vikram was my right hand...doing most of my work. So, he used to interact with her more vigorously," Bhatt added.

138.title: Windshield of Go First's Delhi-Guwahati flight cracks mid-air, flight diverted to Jaipur
138.article_body: The windshield of Go First's Delhi-Guwahati flight cracked mid-air after which the flight was diverted to Jaipur due to bad weather in Delhi, Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) officials said. This is the third incident of technical malfunction on a Go First aircraft in two days. On Tuesday, Go First's Mumbai-Leh and Srinagar-Delhi flights faced engine snags.

139.title: Bihar Cabinet approves lease exemption of up to 80% on govt land
139.article_body: Nitish Kumar-led Bihar Cabinet on Tuesday announced an exemption of up to 80% on land leases under the Bihar Industrial Area Development Authority (BIADA). It approved the decision for 54 units under BIADA. The rate of BIADA units has been decreased by 80% for 15 units, 60% and 40% for 12 units each and 20% for 15 units.

140.title: Maha man sets himself, wife & son on fire; he dies, other 2 survive
140.article_body: A 58-year-old man died after he set himself, his wife and son on fire while all three of them were in a car in Nagpur on Tuesday, police said. A suicide note recovered from the man's house said he was ending his life due to financial crisis, police added. The man's 55-year-old wife and 30-year-old son sustained serious burn injuries.

141.title: Gr Noida development body to sterilise street dogs free of charge
141.article_body: Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) will sterilise all street dogs in its jurisdiction, which aren't covered by resident welfare associations, for free, officials said. "GNIDA will [also] bear...cost of...rabies vaccination for street dogs," a senior official from the development body said. Additionally, GNIDA will set up animal hospital and shelter for dogs and other animals.

142.title: Policeman tries to stop truck in Gujarat, it mows him down
142.article_body: A truck mowed down a policeman in Gujarat's Borsad on Wednesday at 1 am. Constable Kiran Raj was trying to stop the "suspicious" truck from Rajasthan when it ran over him, ANI reported. Raj died during treatment in hospital. This is the third incident in India in 24 hours in which a police officer was run over by a truck.

143.title: Ukraine did not fulfil terms of preliminary peace deal: Putin
143.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday said that Ukraine had not fulfilled the terms of what he described as a preliminary peace deal agreed with the Ukrainian government in March. However, Putin did not elaborate on his claim. Notably, there was no immediate response from the Ukrainian government to the Russian President's remarks.

144.title: FM will reply to Opposition's questions once she recovers from COVID: BJP's Joshi
144.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said that the central government is ready for discussion on inflation in Parliament. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is down with COVID and she will reply to questions once she recovers and when Business Advisory Committee decides and both chairs give permission. His statements come after Congress claimed that government is not allowing discussion on GST rates.

145.title: Is it unparliamentary to discuss inflation?: Priyanka Gandhi to PM Modi
145.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Wednesday alleged that PM Narendra Modi is increasing household expenditure while shying away from discussion on it in Parliament. "Is it 'unparliamentary' to discuss inflation?" she tweeted. Priyanka said that the government has increased the burden of inflation by imposing "Grihasthi Satyanash Tax (GST)" (household destruction tax) on grains, jaggery and curd.

146.title: DDA must register real estate projects with us: Delhi-RERA Chairman
146.article_body: Delhi Development Authority (DDA) must register its real-estate projects with the regulator to protect the interest of property buyers, said Delhi-Real Estate Regulatory Authority (RERA) Chairman Anand Kumar. Delhi-RERA has the power to take action against organisations that fail to register projects with them, he said. "If DDA delays [its] project...who is going to suffer? The buyer," he added.

147.title: 37-yr-old man held for cheating people with fake job offers in Mumbai
147.article_body: A 37-year-old man, Sandeep Raut, was arrested for cheating several people in Mumbai by promising jobs at companies like ONGC, RBI and other institutions. Police said the accused has over 18 cases registered against him across Maharashtra. Mumbai Police raided the guest house where he was staying and seized 12 ID cards, five appointment letters, rubber stamps and notary papers.

148.title: 30-yr-old woman kills self by jumping into Hussain Sagar lake in Hyd
148.article_body: A 30-year-old woman, identified as Sailaja, allegedly died by suicide after jumping into Hussain Sagar lake in Hyderabad on Wednesday morning. According to the police, the woman jumped into the lake from the NTR Garden side and locals who noticed this, informed the police. The woman's body was shifted to Gandhi Hospital mortuary and a case has been registered.

149.title: In 21st century, we must give people right to live life on own terms: Mahesh on Sushmita
149.article_body: Filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt, speaking about Sushmita Sen, told ETimes, "She has the guts to live on her own dictates." "My personal belief is that we must in the second decade of...21st century give human beings...right to live life on their own terms," he added. Sushmita recently announced that she is dating Lalit Modi.

150.title: 5 officers under UP minister Jitin Prasada suspended over irregularities
150.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government suspended five senior officers of the Public Works Department (PWD) under PWD Minister Jitin Prasada over alleged irregularities in transfers during the current transfer session. This comes after Prasada's Officer on Special Duty (OSD) Anil Kumar Pandey was removed. CM Yogi Adityanath had ordered a probe on July 12 following complaints of irregularities in the transfers.

151.title: Fans erect 75-feet banner of 'Liger' actor Vijay Deverakonda in Hyderabad
151.article_body: Fans of actor Vijay Deverakonda, who will be seen in the film 'Liger' and starred in the movie 'Arjun Reddy', reportedly erected a 75-feet banner where the actor can be seen shirtless, at Sudarshan 35MM theatre in Hyderabad. The banner has been put for the trailer launch of 'Liger' which will take place tomorrow. 'Liger' marks Vijay's first Bollywood film.

152.title: 2 burglars held for stealing valuables worth ₹2.5 lakh from a Mumbai house
152.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested two burglars, Shakib Shaukat Ali Ansari and Ahil Haroon Chaudhary, who used to visit cities on the pretext of travelling and commit burglaries. Police officials claimed the accused stole cash and ornaments worth about ₹2.5 lakh from a house in Malad last month. The accused were arrested from Delhi and Uttar Pradesh.

153.title: Ground will change but not your stubbornness: PM Modi to CWG athletes
153.article_body: While interacting with athletes who will represent India at the CWG 2022, PM Narendra Modi gave a message to those athletes who'll represent India at the international level for the first time. "I'd say the ground has changed, not your mood, not your stubbornness. The goal is to see the tricolour fluttering...make an impact with...strong game," said PM Modi.

154.title: Those who've played 1-2 matches are giving opinions on Kohli: Kamran Akmal
154.article_body: Ex-Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Kamran Akmal has criticised those questioning Virat Kohli's current form, stating that every cricketer "goes through these phases". "Some players endure it for a brief period, some...for long...[but] people who've played one-two matches are giving opinions on him. I can only laugh," added Akmal. Kohli last scored a century in international cricket in November 2019.

155.title: Delhi-NCR to witness moderate to heavy rainfall, yellow alert issued
155.article_body: With parts of Delhi-NCR witnessing heavy rain on Wednesday, the IMD has issued a yellow alert for the national capital. The IMD forecast for the next two hours shows a likelihood of moderate to heavy intensity rainfall. The department's forecast alludes to the possibility of waterlogging and traffic disruptions. Moderate rainfall is expected on Thursday, Friday and Saturday as well.

156.title: Turkish President keeps Putin waiting ahead of talks in Iran; video surfaces
156.article_body: A video showing Russian President Vladimir Putin waiting for his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdoğan ahead of talks in Iran on Tuesday has surfaced on social media. In footage of the meeting, Putin was seen mouth twitching and his stance shifting as he waited almost a minute. It is Putin's second trip outside of Russia since he invaded Ukraine.

157.title: Joe Russo arrives in Mumbai ahead of 'The Gray Man' premiere, pics surface
157.article_body: Filmmaker Joe Russo has arrived in Mumbai ahead of the premiere of his upcoming film 'The Gray Man'. Pictures of 'The Gray Man' co-director Joe Russo have surfaced as he was spotted at the Kalina airport in Mumbai. Dhanush, who is part of the film, also arrived in Mumbai. Ryan Gosling and Chris Evans star in the film.

158.title: Told Salman 'You won't look back after this film': Govinda on 'Partner'
158.article_body: Discussing the film 'Partner' where he starred with actor Salman Khan, actor Govinda said, "Once I was leaving the set and randomly...told Salman...'You won't look back after this film', and that's...what happened." "Salman and I...have a love-hate relationship," Govinda had said, discussing their relationship. Salman had shared that he was "very scared" to act with Govinda at one point.

159.title: Film with Prabhas will go on the floors in September: 'RRR' producer
159.article_body: Producer DVV Danayya, who also produced SS Rajamouli's 'RRR', has said that his upcoming project with actor Prabhas will go on the floors in September. He further revealed that the film will completely be shot in India and the process of casting the leading lady for the film is going on. The film will be a supernatural action thriller.

160.title: Cyberabad Police destroy drugs worth ₹2.5 crore
160.article_body: The Cyberabad Police have destroyed drugs worth about ₹2.5 crore by incineration at Hyderabad Waste Management Project in Dundigal. These drugs included a total of 1338.05 kg of ganja (cannabis), 485 ml of weed oil and 11 grams of cocaine. "[We] have built a robust informant network to assist combat the drug problem," police said.

161.title: SC grants bail to Mohammed Zubair in all 6 cases registered across UP
161.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday granted bail to Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair in all the six cases registered against him across UP for hurting religious sentiments through tweets. The SIT formed by the UP DGP is "redundant and must be disbanded," the court said. Transfer all cases to the Special Cell of the Delhi Police, the court ordered.

162.title: Indonesian court rejects call to legalise marijuana for medical use
162.article_body: Indonesia's Constitutional Court on Wednesday rejected a judicial review of country's narcotics law on legalising use of marijuana for medicinal purposes. The rejection came as three mothers of children with cerebral palsy had filed judicial review of law, arguing the need to use marijuana to treat symptoms. The court urged government to "immediately" conduct research on therapeutic use of drug.

163.title: Scientists discover 2 new crocodile species that lived 15-18 mn years ago
163.article_body: Scientists have discovered two new crocodile species known as giant dwarf crocodiles - Kinyang mabokoensis and Kinyang tchernovi that lived between 15 and 18 million years ago. These crocodiles may have grown to over 3.5 m in size. They likely preyed on early humans and once inhabited east Africa before "inexplicably becoming extinct", scientists from the University of Iowa said.

164.title: Heavy rains cause waterlogging in parts of Delhi, traffic affected
164.article_body: Heavy rains lashed parts of Delhi on Wednesday, causing waterlogging in low-lying areas and affecting traffic movement. People shared pictures and videos on Twitter of rainwater gushing into residential areas. Delhi Traffic Police advised people to check the weather before heading out. IMD has predicted a cloudy sky, moderate rain or thundershowers in Delhi over the next three days.

165.title: UP Minister Dinesh Khatik resigns, says officials kept him in the dark
165.article_body: Dinesh Khatik, Minister of State for Jal Shakti in the UP government, has offered his resignation saying department officials didn't listen to him or share information about his ministry. In his resignation letter addressed to Union Home Minister Amit Shah, Khatik claimed he was not kept in the loop by officials. He also alleged widespread corruption in Namami Gange scheme.

166.title: Protest erupts in Sri Lanka as Ranil Wickremesinghe becomes Prez
166.article_body: A group of people protested outside the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo on Wednesday after the election of Ranil Wickremesinghe as the country's new President. "We're shocked...He will start controlling us in a different way. As protesters, we will start our struggle again," one of the protesters said. Notably, Wickremesinghe had received 134 votes in the 225-member Parliament.

167.title: I love Alia Bhatt's work & her spirit, I look forward to her work: Ananya
167.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday has revealed that she has been a fan of actress Alia Bhatt "all along". "I love her work...I love her spirit. I'm always looking forward to her work," she added. Speaking about Alia, Ananya further said, "There's so much she packs in, with so much nuance and novelty....she has some amazing pieces of work to her credit."

168.title: 4 arrested for offering Maha BJP MLA a ministerial post for ₹100 cr
168.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested four men for allegedly offering Rahul Kul, BJP MLA from Maharashtra's Daund, a ministerial post for ₹100 crore. Kul met one of the accused in South Mumbai where he bargained to reduce the offer to ₹90 crore. Mumbai Police's Anti Extortion Cell had laid a trap to arrest the accused before their second meeting with Kul.

169.title: I salute Sushmita Sen for living life on her own terms: Mahesh Bhatt
169.article_body: Filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt defended Sushmita Sen after she was trolled over her relationship with Lalit Modi. "What I salute her for is that she has lived her life on her own terms," he stated. "My...belief is that we must in the second decade of the 21st century give human beings the right to live life on their...terms," he added.

170.title: Public wants Parliament to work: Om Birla on sloganeering by Oppn
170.article_body: On the third day of monsoon session of the Parliament on Wednesday, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said the public wants the Parliament to work. His statement came as Lok Sabha was adjourned amid sloganeering by the Opposition MPs today. "I want to tell those members who are indulging in sloganeering that they should take part in discussions," Birla added.

171.title: Fight breaks out between 2 groups at Noida's Amity University, 3 held
171.article_body: The Noida police have arrested three students of Amity University after a fight broke out between two groups on Tuesday, officials said on Wednesday. A fight broke out outside gate no. 2 of the university, following which one group beat the other with sticks, said Vikash Kumar Jain, Station House Officer, Noida Sector 126 police station.

172.title: 5 businessmen arrested for betting on India-England ODI in Lonavala
172.article_body: Five businessmen from Gujarat have been arrested from a bungalow in Lonavala for betting on the third one-day international (ODI) cricket match between India and England. The arrests were made after a raid was conducted on the bungalow located in Apti Village in Lonavala on July 17. They have been remanded to three-day police custody.

173.title: Sanjay Raut quotes Premchand, says betrayal is easiest way out
173.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Wednesday tweeted a picture of him holding hands with Uddhav Thackeray, and added a couple of lines of Premchand, which says that betrayal is the easiest way out.
