Raut on Tuesday launched a veiled attack on Twitter at Shinde's faction and said, "Do not leave the forest because of the fear of snakes."

174.title: Mumbai-Pune intercity train Pragati Exp to get one Vistadome coach
174.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) has decided to add one Vistadome coach in Pragati Express, which is a daily superfast intercity train plying between Pune and Mumbai via Panvel. Vistadome coaches are European-style coaches equipped with advanced features such as large glass windows, glass roofs, observation lounges etc. After the addition, CR will have total four trains running with Vistadome coaches.

175.title: Gangster involved in Sidhu Moosewala's murder shot dead by police in encounter
175.article_body: A gangster involved in killing of singer Sidhu Moosewala has been killed by Punjab Police in an encounter at a village in Punjab's Amritsar district. Three policemen are said to be injured in the encounter. The encounter broke out after police received a tip-off about accused Jagroop Rupa and Mannu Kusa being present in the village.

176.title: Some people tried to shoot me saying I'm spoiling Indian culture: Mallika
176.article_body: Actress Mallika Sherawat said some people tried to "shoot her" saying she is "spoiling" Indian culture. "I was an easy target because I had no support in Bollywood...Mahesh Bhatt once told me, 'You keep on falling and crying, so some people in Bollywood enjoy that'," added Mallika. Mallika stated her glamour was too much to handle for Indian women.

177.title: 6 die after drinking country liquor from hooch den in West Bengal
177.article_body: A number of people fell ill and were hospitalised allegedly after consuming country liquor from a hooch den in West Bengal's Howrah district on Tuesday. Six of them died on Wednesday. Few others are reportedly in a critical condition. The cause of the deaths has not been confirmed. However, police have arrested the owner of the liquor shop, Pratap Karmakar.

178.title: 27-year-old man held for unnatural sex with 7-year-old boy in Pune
178.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Police arrested a 27-year-old man for having unnatural sex with a seven-year-old boy. The accused lured the victim, who was playing in a garden, by offering him chocolate, police said. He later had unnatural sex with the boy and escaped from the spot, police added. The incident happened on Sunday and the accused was arrested on Monday.

179.title: Jennifer, Affleck were emotional at their wedding; they cried: Witness
179.article_body: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck, who recently tied the knot, were emotional during their wedding, Kenosha Portis has said. Kenosha, who watched the ceremony, said, "It was so exciting...I'm like, 'Oh my god, this is Jennifer Lopez we're getting ready to marry'." Kenosha added the duo cried during the wedding and the couple's children "were right there behind them".

180.title: This shows his arrogance: Cong MP on Assam CM's 'tricolour' remark
180.article_body: Reacting to Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma’s remark where he asked residents to hoist tricolour at homes to prove they're "genuine children" of 'Bharat Mata', Congress' Manickam Tagore said this shows Sarma's arrogance. "It should be the RSS that must be asked to put tricolour...because, for 52 long years, they didn't put Tiranga at their offices," Tagore added.

181.title: Cancerous tumour removed from man's body via rare procedure in Pune
181.article_body: A cancerous tumour was removed from a 63-year-old man's body via a rare procedure at a defence hospital in Pune. The patient underwent electro-cautery, which is a first-of-its-kind procedure in armed forces medical establishment, a release stated. "The three-hour-long [surgery was performed by]....five doctors...leading to relief of obstructions and...expansion of [patient's] left lung," it read.

182.title: Cocaine worth ₹15 cr seized from Zimbabwean national at IGI Airport
182.article_body: Customs officers at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport seized over 1 kg of cocaine worth ₹15 crore from a Zimbabwean national on Wednesday. The woman had arrived at the airport from Ethiopia's Addis Ababa and had concealed the narcotic in the soles of her sandals, ANI reported. She has been arrested under Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985.

183.title: 'Ya Ali' singer Zubeen Garg hospitalised due to head injury after falling in bathroom
183.article_body: Singer Zubeen Garg, known for singing Ya Ali song from 'Gangster', has been admitted to a private hospital in Assam. The singer was admitted to the hospital after he sustained a head injury. Zubeen was reportedly in a resort in Dibrugarh when he slipped in the bathroom. Doctors revealed that he had a seizure following an epileptic fit, said reports.

184.title: Babar Azam completes 3,000 runs in Test cricket
184.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam completed 3,000 runs in Test cricket in the first Test against Sri Lanka at Galle. In his 73 innings, Babar has now scored 3,025 runs, including seven centuries and 22 half-centuries, at an average of 47.26. In the match against Sri Lanka, Babar scored 119 runs in the first innings and 55 in the second.

185.title: Parliament's functioning affected due to Modi govt's obstinacy: Congress
185.article_body: The Congress on Wednesday alleged that the PM Narendra Modi-led government is not allowing a discussion in Parliament on the issue of hike in GST on food items. "Government's obstinacy to not permit a debate on the matter has affected Parliament's functioning," Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said. The Modi government is blocking desire of poor and middle class, he added.

186.title: Noida Police arrest 5 for robbery in over a dozen houses
186.article_body: Noida Police have arrested a gang of five men for allegedly carrying out robberies in over a dozen houses in Uttar Pradesh. Police said they also recovered jewellery worth around ₹8 lakh from them. "The gang moved in a car in the city for recce and targeted...houses that were locked. They decamped with mainly jewellery and cash," police said.

187.title: SC grants bail to Mohammed Zubair in all 6 cases, orders immediate release
187.article_body: The Supreme Court has granted interim bail to fact-checking website Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair in all the six FIRs registered against him in Uttar Pradesh and ordered immediate release. The court further clubbed all the FIRs registered against Zubair and transferred all of the FIRs lodged in Uttar Pradesh to Delhi Police Special Cell, according to report.

188.title: No plan to exempt cryptocurrency transactions from taxes: Govt
188.article_body: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said the government is not considering any plan to reduce taxes on cryptocurrency transactions. In Budget 2022, the government had announced a flat 30% tax on income from cryptocurrencies and a 1% TDS on cryptocurrency transactions. Chaudhary said RBI has also started working on phased implementation of introduction of the Digital Rupee.

189.title: Why was she deployed on night duty?: J’khand BJP MP on sub-inspector’s death
189.article_body: Following a female sub-inspector, Sandhya Topno's death after being mowed down by a vehicle in Jharkhand, state BJP MP Sanjay Seth said the law and order has collapsed in the state. "It is a matter of investigation why Sandhya Topno was deployed on night duty. I will raise the issue...in Parliament today," Seth said on Wednesday.

190.title: MahaRERA to issue show-cause notices to 4,555 lapsed projects: Report
190.article_body: Maharashtra Real Estate Regulatory Authority (MahaRERA) will start issuing suo motu show-cause notices to developers of 4,555 lapsed real estate projects in the state from July 25, Moneycontrol reported citing senior MahaRERA officials. Of the 4,555 lapsed projects, Pune and Mumbai account for 1,216 and 649 lapsed projects. Notices will initially be issued to projects with over 50% booking.

191.title: Hardik Pandya said 'Sir, please get me through 2019 World Cup': Ex-India trainer
191.article_body: Talking about all-rounder Hardik Pandya, former Team India strength and conditioning coach Shanker Basu said that he was sore during the 2019 World Cup after having played IPL ahead of the ICC tournament. "He said to me 'Sir, please get me through this World Cup. I need to be fit'. And I got him through," Basu stated.

192.title: 5, including 2 children, killed after truck overturns on car in UP
192.article_body: At least five people, including two children, died and three others were injured after a truck overturned on their car in Uttar Pradesh. According to police, the accident took place on Tuesday night when eight members from two families were returning home after dinner. The accident occurred on the Raebareli-Prayagraj highway following which locals rushed to help the victims.

193.title: Noida twin towers to be loaded with explosives from Aug 2 to Aug 20
193.article_body: Noida's Supertech twin towers, located in Sector 93A, will be loaded with explosives from August 2 to August 20 and will be demolished at 2.30 pm the next day, the Noida Authority was told on Tuesday. When explosives would be placed, nobody except the staff of the demolition firm, Edifice Engineering, would be allowed inside the premises, officials said.

194.title: Ben Stokes gifts his last-ever ODI cap to a young fan, pics go viral
194.article_body: England all-rounder Ben Stokes gifted his last-ever ODI cap to a young fan, with pictures of the fan wearing the signed cap going viral. "What a souvenir! Wow," a fan commented on the picture. "Lucky kid," wrote another. Stokes registered bowling figures of 5-0-44-0 and scored 5(11) in his last ODI against South Africa on Tuesday.

195.title: Encounter breaks out between Punjab Police, 2 suspected Moosewala killers; video surfaces
195.article_body: An encounter is underway in Bhakna village in Punjab's Amritsar district between the Punjab Police and two gangsters, believed to be involved in killing of singer Sidhu Moosewala. As per reports, Punjab Police got a tip-off about gangsters Jagroop Singh Roopa and Manpreet Singh alias Mannu Kusa being in the Bhakna village. A video of the encounter has surfaced online.

196.title: It's unfair to say ODI series vs WI is make or break for Dhawan: Rohan Gavaskar
196.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Rohan Gavaskar has said it's "unfair" to say that the upcoming three-match ODI series against West Indies is "make or break" for Shikhar Dhawan. "Dhawan is an exceptional performer in international cricket and he has been so for a while...Even if he stops playing tomorrow, he will look back at his career with a lot of pride," stated Rohan.

197.title: Businessman dies after setting car with family inside on fire in Maha; video surfaces
197.article_body: A 58-year-old businessman, who was going through financial troubles, died allegedly after he set himself and his family on fire in his car on Tuesday in Maharashtra's Nagpur. Police said his wife and son, who survived with severe burns, were unaware of the man's motive as he told them he was taking them for lunch. A suicide note was recovered.

198.title: When actor does film for his friends, it only breaks friendship: Ranbir
198.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said that it's important for any profession to keep friendship and work separate. "I have seen it with my father (late actor Rishi Kapoor), that actors do film for their friends and that only breaks the friendship," he stated. Ranbir added, "For me, when I work, I prefer working...not socialising, so I like to be detached."

199.title: Frog wedding held in UP's Gorakhpur to end drought-like situation
199.article_body: A wedding ceremony of two frogs was held in UP's Gorakhpur in the belief that it will bring rain and end drought-like situation in the state that has received less-than-normal rain this monsoon. A large number of people reportedly attended the ceremony which was organised by the Hindu Mahasangh. The ritual will certainly work, people present at the ceremony said.

200.title: Destroyer of peace: China as US warship sails through Taiwan Strait
200.article_body: The US is a "maker of security risks" in the Taiwan Strait, the Chinese military said on Wednesday as another US warship sailed through the waterway. "The frequent provocations and showing off by...US fully demonstrate that...US is a destroyer of peace...in the Taiwan Strait," it added. The vessel transited through Taiwan Strait "in accordance with international law", US Navy said.

201.title: Yuvraj Singh, Harbhajan approached for 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10': Reports
201.article_body: Ex-Indian cricketers Yuvraj Singh, Harbhajan Singh and Suresh Raina have been reportedly approached to participate in the tenth season of the reality dance show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa'. Ex-Sri Lankan player Lasith Malinga has also been approached, the reports added. A source informed ETimes TV that there are high chances of Yuvraj doing the show and will soon sign the deal.

202.title: Director Sukumar said we have scope for 'Pushpa 3': Fahadh Faasil
202.article_body: Actor Fahadh Faasil has said there was no part one or part two when the film 'Pushpa' was offered to him. He added filmmaker Sukumar had originally planned the film to be an OTT series on red sandalwood. "Recently when I spoke with him, he said we have scope for 'Pushpa 3' also. We have so much material," he added.

203.title: Bumrah's execution was absolutely spot on against England: Agarkar
203.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ajit Agarkar has said Jasprit Bumrah's execution was absolutely spot on during the ODIs against England. "Yes, there was help in the pitch, the conditions were suitable for fast bowling but the execution of his skills was absolutely spot on...We saw everything that a fast bowler should have," stated Agarkar. Bumrah picked eight wickets in two England ODIs.

204.title: Hyderabad police arrest 2 automobile thieves; recover 12 motorcycles
204.article_body: Hyderabad's Meerpet police on Tuesday arrested two people for stealing motorcycles. The police also seized 12 motorcycles and a mobile phone, all worth ₹6 lakh from the accused. They were arrested while going to dispose a stolen vehicle, police said. Both the accused are residents of Nagarkurnool district and have been involved in several cases across Hyderabad, police added.

205.title: Earth is basically empty of humans: Elon Musk on graphic showing population density
205.article_body: While commenting on a Twitter thread explaining population density across the world, Elon Musk wrote, "Earth is basically empty of humans." Earlier this month, Musk had said that he is "doing his best to help the underpopulation crisis" after reports claimed that he welcomed twins with Neuralink top executive Shivon Zilis in November 2021.

206.title: Maharashtra's Solapur BJP leader Shrikant Deshmukh booked for rape
206.article_body: Maharashtra BJP leader Shrikant Deshmukh was booked on rape charges after a woman filed a complaint in Pune. He promised to marry her and under that pretext raped her on multiple occasions in Solapur, Pune, Mumbai and Sangli, she alleged. A video of the woman and Deshmukh, in which she is seen accusing him of cheating her, recently surfaced online.

207.title: Former athlete PT Usha takes oath as Rajya Sabha MP
207.article_body: Renowned former Olympic track and field athlete PT Usha took oath as Rajya Sabha MP (Member of Parliament) on Wednesday. The government nominated her to the Upper House of the Parliament along with renowned composer Ilaiyaraaja, screenwriter V Vijayendra Prasad and spiritual leader Veerendra Heggade on July 6. Hailing from Kerala, PT Usha is one of India's most iconic sportspersons.

208.title: Reports claim India influenced Sri Lanka Presidential elections; govt denies
208.article_body: The High Commission of India in Colombo on Wednesday tweeted, "We have seen baseless and purely speculative media reports about efforts at political level from India to influence...elections in Sri Lankan Parliament to the post of President." "We categorically deny these media reports as completely false. They are clearly a figment of someone's imagination," it wrote.

209.title: Hardik can make it to any team for Tests purely as a batter: Nehra
209.article_body: Ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said all-rounder Hardik Pandya can make it to any team in Test matches purely as a batter. Virat Kohli had earlier said that Hardik will need to bowl in Tests. "[I don't see] Hardik bowling 15 to 18 overs a day...He's far away from getting into the red-ball circuit," ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer had stated.

210.title: Hoist tricolour at homes to prove you're genuine children of 'Bharat Mata': Assam CM
210.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma asked all residents to hoist the tricolour between August 13 and 15 at their houses in order to prove that they are "genuine children of Bharat Mata". "Applying for NRC to say that you are Indian citizens is not enough. You have to give proof…Is it or not?" Sarma asked at an event on Tuesday.

211.title: US House passes bill to protect same-sex & interracial marriages
211.article_body: The US House of Representatives on Tuesday voted 267-157 to pass a bill protecting same-sex and interracial marriages under federal law. Forty-seven Republicans joined all Democrats in voting in favour of the bill. This comes amid concerns that the recent Supreme Court ruling ending abortion rights could endanger other precedents. The bill will now go to US Senate for vote.

212.title: Cruel to raise tax rates when CPI inflation is over 7%: Jairam Ramesh
212.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said that it is cruel to raise tax rates when CPI inflation is over 7%. "It is cruel…WPI inflation is over 15%, unemployment is high, the rupee is depreciating, the current account deficit is widening and inflation is expected to rise worldwide," he stated in a thread of tweets.

213.title: Electoral offences committed by Prez candidate Murmu: Congress to EC
213.article_body: The Congress party has alleged violation of provisions of the law by NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu in the July 18 election and has filed a complaint with the Election Commission (EC) regarding it. The Karnataka Congress claimed that the BJP "bribed and exerted undue influence" on its MLAs on July 17 and 18 asking them to vote for Murmu.

214.title: Order that prohibited restaurants from levying service charge stayed by Delhi HC
214.article_body: Delhi High Court on Wednesday stayed the guidelines to prohibit restaurants from levying service charges that were issued by Central Consumer Protection Authority till next court hearing on November 25. It, however, stated eateries must prominently display that they levy service charge. National Restaurant Association of India had earlier moved the court against the guidelines.

215.title: 347 sanitation workers died across India in last 5 years: Govt data
215.article_body: At least 347 sanitation workers died across India in the last five years, the Centre informed Lok Sabha on Tuesday. While Uttar Pradesh saw the highest number of deaths at 51, Tamil Nadu and Delhi stood at 48 and 44, respectively. In these years, 2019 saw the highest number of deaths at 116, followed by 92 deaths in 2017.

216.title: Chinese media doesn’t even mention ‘talks’: Chidambaram after 16th round of talks
216.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Wednesday said that the 16th round of talks between India and China on the "border disputes" ended, as expected, without an agreement. "While Indian media reports 'no breakthrough in talks', Chinese media does not even mention the talks," Chidambaram tweeted. "China has conceded nothing on 'Hot Springs'," he added.

217.title: No disqualification of MLAs yet, issue may require a 5-judge bench: SC on Shiv Sena crisis
217.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday said that the issues involved in the petitions over the Shiv Sena crisis might require to be referred to a five-judge bench for consideration. The Speaker will maintain the status quo and not decide on any disqualification of rebel MLAs, SC added. It also directed the Legislative Assembly secretary to keep all records in safe custody.

218.title: 21-yr-old US vlogger gang-raped by 2 men at hotel in Pakistan
218.article_body: A 21-year-old US vlogger was allegedly gang-raped by two men at a hotel in Punjab province of Pakistan, police said on Tuesday. "The suspects gang-raped me and also made a video of the act to blackmail me," she alleged in the FIR. Police has already arrested one of the two suspects and is conducting raids to arrest the other.

219.title: Mann criticises Centre for not giving representation to Punjab in MSP panel
219.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann has criticised Centre for not giving the state a representation in the panel formed on minimum support price (MSP). "Punjab's farmers are...stuck in crop cycle and debt. MSP is our legal right," he said. Besides members of agricultural universities and central government secretaries, the panel also includes chief secretaries of Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Sikkim and Odisha.

220.title: Delhiites to receive 'opt-in' forms for subsidy with electricity bills from Aug
220.article_body: The Delhi government will send out 'opt-in' forms to consumers along with their electricity bills from August that will require them to state whether they want to avail power subsidy or not, according to officials. Consumers will have to submit the forms at the zonal offices of their respective discoms if they wish to avail the subsidy, the officials added.

221.title: Flipkart announces The Zero Hour live sale for Nothing Phone (1)
221.article_body: Flipkart shared that it's back again with one of the most awaited global launches of the year. It has announced the first-ever live sale of Nothing Phone (1) on July 21, 7 PM. The event will be hosted by Gaurav Kapur with Rajiv Makhani, Masaba Gupta, Manushi Chillar, and Jim Sarbh sharing their views on the phone on Flipkart Live.

222.title: Ranil Wickremesinghe elected as new President of Sri Lanka amid economic crisis
222.article_body: Amid the economic crisis in Sri Lanka, Ranil Wickremesinghe was on Wednesday elected as the new President of the country. This comes after Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who fled the country along with his wife, resigned from the post. Sri Lanka is effectively bankrupt and facing acute shortages of food, fuel and other basic supplies.

223.title: I don't know where we are going: Kamran Akmal on Pakistan cricket
223.article_body: Pakistani cricketer Kamran Akmal said he "doesn't know" where Pakistan cricket is going, considering entry to high-performance training camps being denied to players, who have represented the nation in 100-150 matches. "Can they stop Wasim Akram, Shoaib Akhtar...?...[PCB Chairman] Ramiz Raja used to come...years after retiring from the game. Can [they]...dare to stop him now?" added Kamran.

224.title: 1,000 passenger complaints received against Air India in 3 months: Govt
224.article_body: Around 1,000 passenger complaints have been received against Air India during the last three months, MoS for Civil Aviation VK Singh said. Furthermore, he said, the complaints were related to staff behaviour, refund of fares and overbooking of flights among others. "Ministry of Civil Aviation has been receiving grievances related to air transport, including Air India," Singh stated.

225.title: Govt releases rules for Work from Home for Special Economic Zones
225.article_body: The Ministry of Commerce & Industry has released rules for Work from Home for Special Economic Zones. "WFH allowed for a maximum period of one-year; may be extended to maximum 50% of total employees including contractual employees," it said. "Development Commissioners of SEZs empowered to extend it beyond one-year and for more than 50% of total employees," the ministry added.

226.title: Video shows TN minister angry as journalist questions him for being late
226.article_body: A video showing Tamil Nadu Rural Development Minister KR Periakaruppan furious after a journalist questioned him about arriving late at an event has gone viral. Periakaruppan reportedly was a few hours late. When a journalist confronted him, he said, "Who waited for three hours? Who gave such an interview? Who waited inside?" He then approached the person recording the video.

227.title: 554 sq km forest land diverted for non-forestry purposes in last 3 yrs: Govt
227.article_body: About 554.3 square kilometres of forest land in the country has been diverted for non-forestry purposes in last three years, government informed the Lok Sabha on Monday. According to data presented by Union Minister of State (MoS) for Environment Ashwini Kumar Choubey, mining accounted for maximum diversion of 112.78 square kilometres of land, followed by road construction.

228.title: Delhi HC to hear all pleas challenging Agnipath scheme on August 25
228.article_body: Delhi High Court will hear all the pleas challenging the Centre's Agnipath recruitment scheme on August 25. This comes after Supreme Court transferred three petitions challenging the scheme to Delhi HC. SC asked Kerala, Punjab and Haryana, Patna and Uttarakhand High Courts to transfer all petitions to Delhi HC or keep them pending till a decision comes from Delhi HC.

229.title: It is going to be a tough 2022 and possibly an even tougher 2023: IMF chief
229.article_body: In a blog on global economy, International Monetary Fund chief Kristalina Georgieva, wrote, "It's going to be a tough 2022—and possibly an even tougher 2023, with increased risk of recession." "Inflation is higher than expected and has broadened beyond food and energy prices," Georgieva said, adding, "We'll be projecting a further downgrade to global growth for both 2022 and 2023."

230.title: If we challenge India's match-winners, it'll be a message to the world: Pooran
230.article_body: West Indies white-ball captain Nicholas Pooran has said he wants to send a message to the cricketing world by challenging India's match-winners in their upcoming series. On his side's current form in ODI cricket, Pooran said, "We're trying to find out the right mindset for ODI cricket." West Indies recently lost three-match ODI series at home against Bangladesh.

231.title: Dad Rishi Kapoor called my film choices 'nonsense': Ranbir Kapoor
231.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor revealed his late father Rishi Kapoor wasn't happy with his film choices and added his father was happy when Ranbir joined 'Shamshera'. As per Rishi, Ranbir's film choices were "bakwaas (nonsense)" and didn't feature in films for the masses. "Unfortunately, he hadn't seen the trailer or poster of 'Shamshera', but I know...he's somewhere out there, proud," Ranbir added.

232.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts from July 20-22
232.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will face power outages on Wednesday, Thursday and Friday (July 20-22) as BESCOM is carrying out maintenance and repair works. Most of these works will be done between 10 am and 5.30 pm. The areas that will be affected today include Hondada Circle, Harakanalu etc. While areas that will face power cuts tomorrow include Talagavara, Cheemangala etc.

233.title: Australia cricketer Adam Zampa takes T20 World Cup 2022 trophy underwater, pics surface
233.article_body: During the T20 World Cup 2022 Trophy Tour, Australia leg-spinner Adam Zampa took the trophy underwater at the Great Barrier Reef. "It’s a privilege to be able to bring the World Cup trophy to this precious place and encourage fans around the world to get to Australia later this year," Zampa said. The tournament will commence in Australia in October.

234.title: I'm struggling, need another operation: Wood on injury he suffered in March
234.article_body: England pacer Mark Wood, who has been out of the England squad since suffering an elbow injury against West Indies in March, has revealed that he needs another operation on his elbow. "I'm struggling to be honest...I'm struggling to fully straighten it," stated Wood. "I've got to get it sorted...if I want to be fit for T20 WC," he added.

235.title: Play with 'Koi nahi hai takkar mai, kahan pade ho chakkar mai' mantra: PM to CWG athletes
235.article_body: While interacting with athletes who will represent India at the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022, PM Narendra Modi said, "Play with 'Kohi nahi hai takkar mai, kahan pade ho chakkar mai' mantra." "Play well with all your strengths, without stress," PM Modi added. CWG 2022 will take place in Birmingham and will begin on July 28.

236.title: Tourist video shows explosion at Hoover Dam in US
236.article_body: A video shot by a tourist showed an explosion and fire at the Hoover Dam, one of the largest hydroelectric facilities in US' Nevada, on Tuesday. "My goodness, something has just blown up," a person can be heard saying in the video. A thick cloud of black smoke and flames could be seen rising from the structure.

237.title: Rahul always disrespected Parliamentary proceedings: Smriti Irani
237.article_body: BJP MP Smriti Irani criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi by saying that he is adamant to bring down the productivity of Lok Sabha. Referring to Rahul Gandhi, she said, "The person who's been politically unproductive is dedicating himself to ensure there's no debate in Parliament." Rahul's entire political history has been dotted with showing disrespect to Parliamentary procedure, she added.

238.title: Punjab Police responds to man who said he was beaten over 'I like you' message to woman
238.article_body: Punjab Police has responded to a man who said he was beaten by a woman's husband after he sent her a message that read "I like you". "Not sure what you were expecting on your unwarranted message to a woman...They should have reported you to us and we would have served you right under right sections of law," police replied.

239.title: Old pic showing 8-yr-old Naomi Osaka watching Nadal play at US Open goes viral
239.article_body: An old picture showing 8-year-old Naomi Osaka watching Rafael Nadal play at the US Open has gone viral on social media. Osaka, now 24, won the US Open in 2018 and 2020. Reacting to the picture that was shared by a user on Twitter, users wrote, "What a moment in time captured," and "Omggggggg this picture is iconic."

240.title: The man I know would never tweet in Hindi: Sudeep on debate with Ajay
240.article_body: Discussing his national language debate on Twitter with Ajay Devgn, Kannada actor Kichcha Sudeep said, "I am...sure the man I know would never tweet in Hindi." "It's definitely a third person's idea," added Sudeep. "If Hindi is not our national language then why do you release your mother tongue movies by dubbing them in Hindi?" Ajay had tweeted in Hindi.

241.title: 14-yr-old girl attacked, molested inside stationary train in Mumbai
241.article_body: A 14-year-old girl was reportedly molested inside a stationary train at Mumbai's Lower Parel railway station. The accused allegedly tricked the girl who had run away from home in Santacruz after a fight and took her to the train, where he sexually assaulted her and attacked her with a blade. She escaped and later filed an FIR with her parents.

242.title: It might well be that IPL is a beneficiary: Scott Styris on Stokes' ODI retirement
242.article_body: Ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris has said Ben Stokes' ODI retirement might be beneficial for the IPL as the England all-rounder might play in the tournament. Stokes had pulled out of IPL 2022 to focus on Test cricket. Styris further said the ODI format is "not in trouble" given "how big" the ODI World Cup was in 2019.

243.title: Australians urged to work from home as COVID hospitalisations rise
243.article_body: Authorities in Australia have urged businesses to let staff work from home as people admitted to hospitals from COVID-19 neared record levels on Wednesday. Authorities also recommended people wear masks indoors and get booster shots urgently. Australia, which is witnessing a COVID-19 surge due to BA.4 and BA.5 Omicron subvariants, has recorded over 3,00,000 cases over the past seven days.

244.title: Russia laying groundwork to annex more of Ukraine: US
244.article_body: Russia is "laying the groundwork" to annex more Ukrainian territory following a similar "playbook" it used to seize Crimea in 2014, US National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said. The steps Russia is planning may include "sham" referenda, installing illegitimate proxy officials, establishing the rouble as official currency and forcing Ukrainians to apply for Russian citizenship, he added.

245.title: Onus on govt to ensure smooth functioning of House: Congress leader
245.article_body: As the Opposition has been protesting against inflation, price rise and other issues, Congress leader Shaktisinh Gohil said the onus is on government to ensure smooth functioning of the House. "When BJP was in Opposition, late Arun Jaitley and their other leaders used to say that it was the responsibility of the government…So, the onus is on government," he added.

246.title: Kerala won't impose GST on essential items sold by small stores: Minister
246.article_body: Kerala government on Tuesday said that it would not impose GST on items sold by organisations like Kudumbashree or small stores in 1 or 2-kilogram packets or in loose quantities. The decision might lead to issues with the Centre, state Finance Minister KN Balagopal said. "Yesterday too, CM Pinarayi Vijayan wrote to the Centre regarding these things," he added.

247.title: Don't agree with press freedom index, methodology questionable: Govt
247.article_body: The Indian government said that it does not agree with the World Press Freedom Index published by international organisation Reporters Without Borders and questioned the methodology used in the assessment. "The government...does not agree to the conclusions...for various reasons including very low sample size, little or no weightage to fundamentals of democracy," Union Minister Anurag Thakur said.

248.title: India reports 20,557 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,45,654
248.article_body: India has reported 20,557 COVID-19 cases and 40 related deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. With 18,517 COVID-19 patients discharged in 24 hours, the active cases now stand at 1,45,654. The total death toll in India has risen to 5,25,825. This comes a day after India reported 15,528 new cases.

249.title: BBMP to fine landlords who allow garbage to be dumped on vacant plots
249.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has asked public to maintain cleanliness at vacant sites in Bengaluru's RR Nagar. In its order, the civic body asked owners to clear garbage and construction waste dumped on their plots, failing which fines of up to ₹1 lakh would be imposed on them. The order was issued following complaints from residents.

250.title: Team India arrive in Trinidad for white-ball series vs WI
250.article_body: Team India arrived in Trinidad on Wednesday ahead of their white-ball series, which is scheduled to begin on Friday. India will play a three-match ODI series between July 22 to July 27 and five-match T20I series beginning on July 29. Senior players including Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and Jasprit Bumrah have been rested, with Shikhar Dhawan captaining in ODIs.

251.title: Inclination towards radical ideologies in India minuscule: Govt
251.article_body: The government said that some foreign agencies inimical to India along with global terrorist groups have been making efforts to radicalise people but “inclination towards radical ideologies is minuscule”, compared to India's population. "Radicalisation by global terrorist groups like ISIS, al-Qaeda etc. is one of the most challenging problems faced by countries," MoS Home Nityanand Rai said.

252.title: Someone else in place of Kohli would've been dropped by now: Kirmani
252.article_body: Discussing Virat Kohli's run drought, former India wicketkeeper Syed Kirmani said, "Had it been someone else in place of Virat, he would've been dropped...by now." Kapil Dev earlier suggested that Kohli should be dropped from India's T20I side considering his performances with the bat. "If he isn't performing...you can't keep the performing youngsters out of the team," he had stated.

253.title: Indian embassy in SL shares pic of injured official; issues advisory for Indian nationals
253.article_body: The High Commission of India in Colombo has shared a picture of an official who "sustained grievous injuries in an unprovoked assault". It released an advisory amid the economic crisis in the country, saying, "Indian nationals in Sri Lanka are requested to remain aware of latest developments and accordingly plan their movements and activities. You may contact us when required."

254.title: List of world's most powerful passports released; India ranks 87th
254.article_body: Japan's passport has been named the most powerful in the world with its citizens having visa-free access to 193 countries, according to the Henley Passport Index. Singapore and South Korea have been ranked second, Germany and Spain third and Finland, Italy and Luxembourg fourth. The Indian passport has secured the 87th rank, with visa-free or visa-on-arrival access to 60 destinations.

255.title: Truck runs over father, daughter after duo falls off bike in Pune
255.article_body: A 35-year-old man and his 10-year-old daughter died after a truck ran over them on the Hadapsar Saswad Road on Tuesday morning. "Primary probe suggests that the father-daughter duo fell on the road after the bike slipped," police said. The incident took place when the man was dropping his daughter at her school. The truck driver has been detained.

256.title: Jackie Chan opened doors for me in H'wood, he's like older brother: Mallika
256.article_body: Talking about Jackie Chan, Mallika Sherawat said, "Jackie Chan is like an older brother to me....He opened all the doors for me in Hollywood." She added Jackie helped her settle in Hollywood after things went bad for her in Bollywood. "Jackie said...'You just land there in LA and you'll get the red carpet treatment', and I did," she stated.

257.title: SC sends notice to NIA on Varavara Rao's bail plea in Bhima-Koregaon case
257.article_body: Supreme Court sent a notice to the National Investigation Agency (NIA) on a plea seeking permanent medical bail filed by activist Varavara Rao in the Bhima-Koregaon case. The court asked NIA to file its counter-affidavit by August 2. SC posted the case for a final hearing on August 10. It had earlier extended the interim bail granted to Rao.

258.title: Will act on demand for Maratha reservation as per Constitution: Bommai
258.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said the state government will act on the demand for Maratha reservation within the provisions of the Constitution. "The state government is considering the proposal. Action would be initiated...after getting...report from the Backward Classes Commission," he said while addressing a function to inaugurate the Maratha Communities Development Corporation.

259.title: Traitors left party but original Sena workers still with us: Aaditya Thackeray
259.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray said that "traitors" have left the party but the original workers are still with them. "This rebellion has unmasked their hatred, jealousy and anger against us. The truth is thus coming out," Aaditya added. "It also means everyone of them used to lie when they claimed to have respect towards the Thackeray family," he stated.

260.title: Water supply to be hit in Thane's Naupada-Kopari area from July 20-22
260.article_body: There will be no water supply in Thane's Naupada-Kopari area on Wednesday, Thursday (July 20-21) and water will be supplied at low pressure on Friday (July 22), officials said. The supply will remain hit due to work on the connection of the newly installed down-take pipe at Kanhaiya Nagar water reservoir in Kopari with the main distribution channel.

261.title: England debutant Potts leaves field after bowling just 4 overs over record-breaking heat
261.article_body: England's 23-year-old debutant Matthew Potts left the field after bowling just four overs in the first ODI against South Africa at the Riverside Ground in Chester-le-Street due to record-breaking heat. Potts was seen sitting in the changing room and rehydrated with a fan on his face. Temperatures at Chester-le-Street hit a record 39°C on Tuesday.

262.title: Extremely heavy to very heavy rainfall warning in several states; list released
262.article_body: IMD has predicted extremely heavy to very heavy rainfall in Uttarakhand, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and Meghalaya between July 20 to 23. Meanwhile, isolated very heavy rainfall is also likely over Himachal Pradesh, Haryana, Chandigarh, Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal, Sikkim, Odisha and East Madhya Pradesh between July 20 and 23.

263.title: Bill Gates congratulates PM Modi as India crosses 2 billion COVID-19 vaccinations
263.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates congratulated Prime Minister Narendra Modi as India crossed 2 billion COVID-19 vaccinations. "Congratulations @narendramodi for yet another milestone of administering #200crorevaccinations. We are grateful for our continued partnership with Indian vaccine manufacturers and the Indian government for mitigating the impact of COVID-19," Gates tweeted.

264.title: Female sub-inspector mowed down to death during vehicle check in Jharkhand
264.article_body: A female sub-inspector named Sandhya Topno died after she was mowed down by a vehicle during vehicle check in Jharkhand on Tuesday night. "She was posted as in-charge of Tupudana OP. The accused has been arrested, and the vehicle has been seized," Ranchi SSP said. Earlier, a DSP was run over by a truck by mining mafia in Haryana.

265.title: Cried my heart out, every Indian should watch it: Anupam on 'Rocketry...'
265.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher posted a video on Instagram, in which he spoke about R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'. In the video, Anupam said, "Thank you Madhavan for making such a brilliant film. If the film can inspire me, it will surely inspire today's generation." He captioned the post, "Cried my heart out. Every Indian should watch it!"

266.title: Mild tremors in Pune's Mulshi, GSI to inspect dam area
266.article_body: Areas around Mulshi dam in Pune on Tuesday reportedly witnessed mild tremors. In a letter, Tata Power clarified that the tremors might be due to controlled explosions or landslides, not earthquakes. District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh has said a team of the Geological Survey of India (GSI) will visit the site to inspect the tremors and investigate the reason behind it.

267.title: I am done being the 'Harry Potter' of Bollywood: Actor Ranbir Kapoor
267.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said he is done being the "Harry Potter" of Bollywood. "I've done the coming of age [films], I have come off age," added Ranbir. Discussing his upcoming film 'Shamshera', Ranbir had said, "It was extremely hard. There were many days when I had given up...I used to go home and speak to Alia Bhatt about it."

268.title: 2 men steal diamonds worth ₹3.5 cr, replace them with fake ones in Mumbai
268.article_body: Two men were booked for allegedly stealing diamonds worth ₹3.5 crore from a jeweller's office in diamond bourse at Mumbai's Bandra-Kurla Complex. The accused reportedly visited the jeweller's office to buy diamonds. They selected a few and, with sleight of hand, replaced them with duplicates and left. Later, when the jeweller realised the diamonds were fake, he filed an FIR.

269.title: It should definitely be a wake-up call: Buttler on Stokes' ODI retirement
269.article_body: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler has said Ben Stokes' ODI retirement should be a "wake-up call" in terms of managing the workload of players. "There's a bit of sadness...But our loss in ODI cricket is certainly going to be England's gain in Test cricket," added Buttler. Stokes announced ODI retirement stating that playing all three formats is "unsustainable" for him.

270.title: India blocked 78 YouTube-based news channels in 2021-2022: Govt
270.article_body: The Ministry of Information and Broadcasting issued directions for blocking 78 YouTube-based news channels and their social media accounts for public access during 2021 and 2022 for violation of Section 69A of the IT Act, 2000, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said. "The MeitY has blocked 560 YouTube URLs during the years 2021 and 2022," he told the Lok Sabha.

271.title: Owaisi accuses Centre of 'politicising' all-party meet on Sri Lanka crisis
271.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi accused Centre of politicising the all-party meeting on Sri Lanka crisis and by raising "unrelated issues" about finances of Indian states. "Dr S Jaishankar...said that there's a 'misinformed campaign and comparison between India and Sri Lanka'. If so, why did the Department of Economic Affairs have to make a presentation?" he asked in a Twitter thread.

272.title: India records 36,29,537 cyber security incidents since 2019 till June 2022: Govt
272.article_body: Union Minister Ajay Kumar Mishra told the Lok Sabha that India recorded 36,29,537 cases related to cyber security since 2019 till June this year. A total of 3,94,499 cyber security incidents in 2019, 11,58,208 in 2020, 14,02,809 in 2021 and 6,74,021 incidents were observed in 2022, upto June, Mishra informed the Lok Sabha.

273.title: My producers tell me 'You double our money in 25 days': Kartik Aaryan
273.article_body: Following the success of his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', actor Kartik Aaryan said, "My producers told me recently, 'You're...an actor who doubles our money in 25 days'." Discussing his struggling days in Bollywood, Kartik stated, "[My] first car...was...a third-hand car...I got it with great difficulty...I took it specifically because I was still taking an auto to the red carpet."

274.title: Producers have star kids to launch, don't know if we'll get chance: Prince
274.article_body: Prince Narula, speaking about his chance in Bollywood, has said, "They (producers) have...many star kids to launch that we don't know if we will ever get a chance." "Even if we get a role, it'll be...some other (side) role," he added. Prince stated that while getting into Bollywood is hard, people's perception has changed after Sushant Singh Rajput's death.

275.title: Police spend 3 nights at a Mumbai station to arrest serial bag lifter
275.article_body: A team of 15 officials from the Government Railway Police (GRP), posing as passengers, spent three consecutive nights at Mumbai's Andheri Railway Station to catch a serial bag lifter. The accused was arrested after he stole a bag belonging to a police inspector of Andheri GRP. The inspector said that they received over 10 complaints from commuters in a month.

276.title: 300% growth in enrolment for Executive MBA program: SP Jain Global
276.article_body: The SP Jain Executive MBA is a global program which aims to transform managers into powerful leaders of tomorrow. The flexible 18-month program is taught by international faculty, has a diverse student body with 16 years of average work experience, includes opportunities to network via newly-introduced global immersion weeks in Singapore and Dubai, and results in an Australian degree.

277.title: 41-yr-old professor kills self in Bengaluru, cites health reasons
277.article_body: A 41-year-old professor was found dead at her residence in West Bengaluru on Monday. According to reports, the deceased, identified as Chaitra HK, used to teach at an engineering college. She reportedly killed herself when her husband and children were away visiting a relative's house. In a purported suicide note, Chaitra cited health issues as a reason behind the step.

278.title: Netflix loses nearly 1 million subscribers in 2nd quarter; share price rises
278.article_body: Netflix has said in its earnings report that it lost 970,000 subscribers in the second quarter, which was less than two million it forecast during its first quarter report in April. After Netflix lost 200,000 subscribers in the first quarter, its shares fell around 67% this year. However, the shares rose 7% to $216 in after-hours trading following latest results.

279.title: Told them to get lost: Mallika Sherawat on being offered 'Jalebi Baby'
279.article_body: Actress Mallika Sherawat revealed she was offered Tesher and Jason Derulo's song 'Jalebi Baby'. "They called me...asked me if I can do this song...I told them, don't call...and get lost. I cut the call then," she stated. Mallika added she was called 'Jalebi Baby' on the US streets and that's when her manager told her the song was a hit.

280.title: Senior citizen loses ₹6.07 lakh in sextortion trap in Mumbai
280.article_body: A Mumbai-based senior citizen ended up losing ₹6.07 lakh in sextortion wherein he was allegedly induced to indulge in nudity by an unknown woman over a video call. Later, he received a call from a person claiming to be a Delhi Police personnel who told him that he had come across his obscene video and demanded money for helping him.

281.title: Pune Metro line to be extended from Garware College to Civil Court
281.article_body: Pune Metro Rail said it is soon going to extend the metro line from Garware College to Civil Court. "The elevated line from Vanaz Station to Civil Court Station will be completed shortly," it added. "It'll take some time to complete the work on Deccan Station, Chhatrapati Sambhaji Station, PMC Station and Civil Court Station on this route," it stated.

282.title: Elon Musk reacts after social media user compares his shirtless pic with a dog
282.article_body: Elon Musk has reacted after a Twitter user compared the Tesla CEO's shirtless picture with a dog. "My calves are bigger tho," Musk commented on the post. Musk's shirtless pictures from his trip to Greece had gone viral on social media. "Maybe I should take off my shirt more often," he had said while responding to the pictures.

283.title: Hyderabad fireman dies by suicide over harassment from loan agents
283.article_body: A 33-year-old fireman allegedly died by suicide in Hyderabad after being harassed over repayment of borrowed money by organisers of online loan apps. The fireman's body was found on the tracks near a railway station on Tuesday. According to police, the deceased had taken loans from instant loan apps, but was unable to repay them due to some financial problems.

284.title: Gang offering loan under govt scheme at discounted rates busted in Delhi
284.article_body: Delhi Police busted a loan fraud gang in Rohini and arrested seven persons, including five women. The accused cheated more than 150 people in one year by offering them loans under the Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana at discounted rates. This comes after a complainant claimed that he had received a message stating he could get a loan of ₹2 lakh.

285.title: Kareena denies pregnancy rumours, says 'Saif has contributed way too much to population'
285.article_body: Kareena Kapoor took to Instagram to deny the rumours claiming she's pregnant for the third time after a picture of her and Saif Ali Khan from their Europe vacation went viral. "It's the pasta and wine guys...calm down...I am not pregnant.. uff...Saif says he has already contributed way too much to the population of our country...enjoy...KKK," she wrote on Instagram.

286.title: 2 Russians, 1 local arrested on drug charges in Himachal's Kullu
286.article_body: Two Russian nationals and a local were arrested in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district on Monday on drug-related charges. According to officials, the accused Russians were to receive a consignment of 116-gram 'charas' from Naggar resident Anup Sharma. The drugs were recovered from Sharma's possession, police informed. Both the Russians are permanent residents of Saint Petersburg, police added.

287.title: Mizoram logged 280 COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, highest in 4 months
287.article_body: Mizoram recorded the highest single-day spike in its COVID-19 tally in four months on Tuesday with 280 fresh cases, according to government statistics. Earlier on March 22, the state had reported 287 new cases. According to an official, Mizoram's daily positivity rate jumped from 26.89% on Monday to 27.72% on Tuesday. The state recorded 57 new cases on Monday.

288.title: Strikes on Syria will destabilise Middle East: Iran to Turkey
288.article_body: Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on Tuesday reportedly told Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan that further military strikes on Syria would destabilise the Middle East. According to Iranian state media, Khamenei also said that strikes on Syria "will benefit terrorists". Turkey has vowed to launch military operations to extend 30-km deep "safe zones" along its border with Syria.

289.title: Delhi-bound flight rejected take-off due to dog on runway in Leh
289.article_body: A flight was rejected take-off from Leh due to a dog on the runway, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said on Tuesday. Go First aircraft VT-WJJ was a Delhi-bound flight, the DGCA added. The DGCA also mentioned that it has conducted several spot checks after reports of increased engineering-related occurrences in scheduled airlines.

290.title: NIA raids 3 Andhra locations in Chhattisgarh Naxal encounter case
290.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) conducted searches in three locations in Andhra Pradesh over the encounter between Chhattisgarh security forces and Naxals last year. The searches were conducted in Vijaywada and Prakasham districts and the NIA seized digital devices and documents including posters, banners, Naxal literature and diaries. In the encounter, 6 Naxals and 1 civilian were killed.

291.title: Rajasthan government dedicated to the youth: CM Ashok Gehlot
291.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot said that state government is dedicated to the youth of the state. While laying the foundation stone of Jamnalal Bajaj Auditorium in Sikar via video conferencing, the CM referred to the various schemes of the state government aimed at the youth. Further, he added that 1.25 lakh government jobs have been provided to the youth.

292.title: France probes origins of wildfire, 1 detained
292.article_body: French investigators detained a 39-year-old man on Tuesday in connection with the suspected, deliberate lighting of forest fires in the country's southwest. The man was detained after reports that a vehicle was seen close to the spot where the fire originally started on July 12. Further, criminal investigators have found evidence pointing to possible arson.

293.title: Outgoing UK PM Boris Johnson chairs final Cabinet meeting
293.article_body: Outgoing UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson presided over his final Cabinet meeting on Tuesday where he defended his government's commitment to tackling climate change. "Who can doubt that we were right to be the first major economy to go for net zero," Johnson said at the meeting. Johnson was forced to resign after a number of scandals hit his party.

294.title: Constructive opposition always welcome in Parliament: Pralhad Joshi
294.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said, "Constructive opposition always welcome in Parliament," in response to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's remark calling the Parliament 'unparliamentary'. Joshi tweeted, "There is no restriction on raising public issues in the Parliament, it was in 1975." Earlier today, the Parliament was adjourned as Opposition MPs raised slogans over inflation issues.

295.title: She borrowed mother's stole: Father of girl allegedly forced to remove bra at NEET centre
295.article_body: The father of a 17-year-old who claimed she was forced to remove her bra at a NEET exam centre in Kollam, Kerala said his daughter had to borrow his wife's stole to cover up. "I wanted to file a case so that no student faces such a plight in...future. It was heartbreaking to see my child so shaken," he stated.

296.title: Another fake IPL betting racket busted in UP's Hapur: Report
296.article_body: The UP Police has busted yet another international betting racket in Hapur that was functioning under the garb of an IPL tournament, a report said. The fake tournament, called 'Big Bash Punjab T20 League', was live streamed on YouTube with matches being played by local players. Russian associates of the organisers used an app called 'Cric Heroes' for placing bets.

297.title: Most parents in Pakistan don't allow their children to play cricket: Rauf
297.article_body: Pakistan pacer Haris Rauf revealed most parents in Pakistan don't allow their children to play cricket or any other sport and his parents also didn't allow him to play cricket initially. "But I continued playing...travelled to different cities for tape-ball cricket without telling my parents where I was going," he added. Rauf has taken 65 wickets in 48 international matches.

298.title: Centre flagged communal remarks on TV 163 times in last 3 year
298.article_body: The Centre flagged communally provocative remarks on TV channels on 163 instances in the last three years, Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur has said. In these cases, the government acted by the issuance of "advisories, warnings, apology scroll orders and off-air orders", Thakur said. He added the government has an institutional mechanism to take action in such situations.

299.title: Shortage of 1.35 lakh personnel in armed forces: Govt
299.article_body: The Centre has said there is a shortage of 1,35,784 personnel in the three armed forces with maximum vacancies in the Army at 1,16,464. The shortage includes soldiers and officers. The annual average recruitments in the Air Force, Navy and Army are 5,723, 5,332 and 60,000 respectively, Minister of State for Defence Ajay Bhatt said.

300.title: K'taka HC denies bail to man who shared army base pics with Pak ISI
300.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has denied bail to Jeetendar Singh, who disguised himself as an Indian Army soldier and took photos of a naval base and shared them with Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence. Justice K Natarajan said the information could affect the sovereignty of India. He further added that if bail is granted, the petitioner could abscond and delay the case.

301.title: Rare twin giraffes born in Kenya, pics surface
301.article_body: Rare twin giraffes have been born at Nairobi National Park, Kenya's Wildlife and Tourism Cabinet Secretary Najib Balala said. "One of the Maasai giraffes has given birth to twins, this is an extremely rare occurrence. We welcome the newborns with love," he tweeted. According to experts, the twinning rate in giraffes is one in every 2,80,000.

302.title: India Women vs Pak Women to be one of the highlights of CWG 2022: CEO Reid
302.article_body: The match between India Women and Pakistan Women will be one of the "highlights" of the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham, said Games CEO Ian Reid. "India and Pakistan will be close to capacity," he added. India will face Pakistan in their second match of Group A on July 31. Notably, women's cricket is making its debut at the Games.

303.title: It was Sharad Pawar who broke Shiv Sena into 2 factions: Ex-Maha MLA
303.article_body:
Former MLA Ramdas Kadam on Tuesday accused NCP chief Sharad Pawar of breaking Sena into two groups. "He was trying to end it since Balasaheb was there but never found a chance," he said. Sena was "systematically weakened" by Pawar, but Uddhav Thackeray wasn't willing to part ways with Pawar, he added.
more at ABP Live

304.title: MoHFW seeks report from Delhi hospital after woman gives birth on floor
304.article_body: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW) sought a report from Delhi's Vardhman Mahavir Medical College and Safdarjung Hospital after a woman delivered her baby on the floor outside the hospital's emergency department on Tuesday. "Submit a detailed report within 48 hours on the above issue," the ministry said. The woman's family alleged that she was denied a maternity ward.

305.title: Turkey court upholds exit from key European treaty protecting women
305.article_body: A Turkish court ruled on Tuesday that President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan’s decision to pull Turkey out of a European treaty safeguarding women's rights against violence was lawful. Turkey withdrew from Council of Europe's Istanbul Convention in 2021, which drew criticism from rights groups. Over 200 women have reportedly been murdered in Turkey so far in 2022 due to gendered violence.

306.title: Twitter wins bid to fast-track trial over Musk's $44-bn deal, trial to be held in Oct
306.article_body: Twitter's lawsuit seeking to hold Elon Musk to his $44-billion takeover will go to trial in October, a judge ruled on Tuesday. This comes after Twitter won its motion for an expedited trial in its lawsuit against Musk. Twitter is seeking to enforce Musk's $44-billion acquisition of the company despite the Tesla CEO's intentions to back out of the deal.

307.title: Lyricist Jaani injured in accident in Punjab, pic of his overturned SUV surfaces
307.article_body: Renowned Punjabi lyricist and music composer Jaani Johan was hospitalised after being injured in a road accident in Mohali on Tuesday. As per reports, 33-year-old Jaani and two others were travelling in an SUV which hit another car and both vehicles flipped after the collision. A pic has shown the 'Pachtaoge' and 'Filhall' lyricist's SUV lying overturned on the road.

308.title: Woman sleepwalks through window in Germany, falls from 5th floor
308.article_body: An 18-year-old woman in Germany's Neubrandenburg was left critically injured as she fell onto the street after sleepwalking through an open window. The woman, who fell from fifth floor of the building, was found by a passerby who then called emergency services. The accident took place just after midnight when the victim was sleepwalking in the flat, preliminary probe found.

309.title: 819 armed forces' personnel died by suicide in last 5 years: Govt
309.article_body: As many as 819 armed forces personnel died by suicide in the last five years, Minister of State for Defence Ajay Bhatt has said. Most numbers of suicides were reported in the Army with 642 cases. "For management of stress and suicides in services, the armed forces are continuously evolving measures to improve the stress mitigating mechanisms," Bhatt added.

310.title: Journalists Welfare Fund to be increased by ₹2 crore: U'khand CM
310.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said that Journalists Welfare Fund would be increased by ₹2 crore. The rules of the pension scheme for journalists must be simplified, he said, adding that monthly assistance given to veteran journalists has been increased from ₹5,000 to ₹8,000. Further, ₹36 lakh was approved from the fund for dependents of journalists and seriously ill journalists.

311.title: 7 persons from Sri Lanka reach Tamil Nadu, handed over to police
311.article_body: Seven persons from Sri Lanka were rescued off the coast of Tamil Nadu's Rameswaram by the Indian Coast Guard and handed over to the police on Tuesday. The rescued persons reportedly fled Sri Lanka to escape the ongoing economic crisis on the island nation. They were dropped by boatmen at the shoals near the island of Rameswaram.

312.title: DRDO signed 1,464 ‘transfer of tech’ agreements with firms so far
312.article_body: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has inked 1,464 'transfer of technology' agreements to date with Indian companies, MoS Defence Ajay Bhatt has said. The DRDO is working towards self-reliance in the defence sector, he said. The minister also said the government is looking to collaborate with a foreign engine company for the co-production of combat jet engines.

313.title: Putin arrives in Tehran for summit with Iranian, Turkish Presidents
313.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrived in Tehran on Tuesday where he will hold talks with his Iranian counterpart Ebrahim Raisi and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan. According to media reports, the trilateral summit will majorly focus on the current situation in Syria. Putin and Erdogan will also deliberate on the issue of Ukrainian grain exports through the Black Sea.

314.title: Russia will set the terms for peace in Ukraine: Medvedev
314.article_body: Deputy Chairman of the Security Council of Russia Dmitry Medvedev on Tuesday said that peace will be established in Ukraine on Moscow's terms. Speaking about the conflict in eastern Europe, he also said, "Russia will achieve all its goals." Earlier, Medvedev had said that NATO and Ukraine's refusal to identify Crimea as part of Russia poses a "systemic threat".

315.title: Covered ourselves with hair after removing bra: Aspirant at Kerala NEET centre
315.article_body: A medical aspirant, one of the many allegedly forced to remove her bra at Kollam NEET exam centre, said, "While writing the exams, we had gone through mental trauma." "We had to cover ourselves with our hair as we didn't have a dupatta and we had to sit with male aspirants which too was indeed a harrowing experience," she added.

316.title: IIT-K incubated startup EndureAir Systems raises $1.7 mn in funding
316.article_body: EndureAir Systems, an IIT Kanpur incubated drone startup, said that it has raised $1.7 million in seed funding from Jalaj Dani, co-promoter of Asian Paints and founders of robotics and automation company Addverb Technologies. The drone startup, was founded in 2019 by IIT Kanpur professors Abhishek and Mangal Kothari, along with their students, Rama Krishna and Chirag Jain.

317.title: Girls were instructed to carry bras in hand on return: Aspirant at Kerala NEET centre
317.article_body: A medical aspirant, one of the many allegedly forced to remove her bra at Kollam NEET exam centre, said, "We were [told]...there'll be scanning...I was asked if I had a hook attached to my inner-wear." "What was even more concerning is that the official...instructed...girls to carry the inner-wear in their hands while returning and not wear it," the aspirant added.

318.title: I feel you had a lot more ODI fuel left, retired too soon: Yuvraj to Stokes
318.article_body: Conveying his best wishes to England all-rounder Ben Stokes following his announcement of ODI retirement, Yuvraj Singh tweeted, "Well done on a fabulous ODI career Stokes! A world-class all-rounder who's an asset for any side. Retired too soon!" He added, "I feel you had a lot more ODI fuel left in you." Stokes is playing in his last ODI today.

319.title: Neobanking startup Niyo raises $30 mn from private equity firm Multiples
319.article_body: Neobanking startup Niyo has raised $30 million from private equity firm Multiples Alternate Asset Management. The company raised $100 million in its Series C funding round in February 2022, led by Accel and Lightrock India. Niyo, founded in 2015 by Virender Bisht and Vinay Bagri, offers banking services in partnership with banks such as Yes Bank, ICICI Bank, among others.

320.title: Samyukta Kisan Morcha rejects govt's MSP committee
320.article_body: The Samyukta Kisan Morcha has rejected the government's committee on Minimum Support Price (MSP). The SKM objected to the presence of some members in the MSP committee, saying they had supported the three contentious farm laws repealed last year. Prime Minister Narendra Modi had repealed the farm laws and promised to form a committee to discuss a legal MSP guarantee.

321.title: Spanish man burnt by wildfire while trying to save town, critical
321.article_body: A man whose clothes caught fire amid a wildfire in Spain's Tabara on Monday has been admitted to the hospital and is critical. The man, Angel Martin Arjona, was trying to dig a trench in a field to stop the approaching fire from reaching his town when the blaze engulfed him. Arjona, who suffered severe burns, was airlifted to hospital.

322.title: 3 women who told girls to remove bras before NEET among 5 detained in Kerala
322.article_body: Kerala Police on Tuesday took five women into custody over complaints of girls being asked to remove their bras before appearing for the NEET medical entrance exam in Kollam. Three of the women were associated with the external agency deputed to frisk students at the exam centre, police said. Two women are staffers of the institute where NEET was held.

323.title: Mamata's nephew came to vote in Prez polls with convoy of cars: MLA
323.article_body: BJP MLA Sudip Mukherjee filed a complaint with Election Commission against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew, Abhishek Banerjee. Mukherjee claimed MP Abhishek brought a convoy of cars inside West Bengal Assembly premises when he came to vote in Presidential polls. According to rules of Presidential elections, MLAs/MPs can enter Assembly only with a car and a driver, Mukherjee said.

324.title: 37-year-old woman killed by a leopard in Uttarakhand's Pauri
324.article_body: A 37-year-old woman, Rina Devi, was killed by a leopard in Uttarakhand's Pauri district on Tuesday, officials said. Rina Devi was attacked while she was returning after dropping her son at his school in a nearby village, District Forest Officer Dinkar Tewari said. The woman's body was recovered from nearby bushes by the forest department, the official added.

325.title: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid features in Shikhar Dhawan's viral reel, fans react
325.article_body: Shikhar Dhawan, who'll lead India in ODI series against West Indies, shared a reel on Instagram which featured Team India head coach Rahul Dravid. Reacting to the viral reel, a fan wrote, "Dravid sir at end...These gen guys making him look so different." Another fan wrote, "Never thought we could ever see Rahul Dravid in a reel."

326.title: Man burnt alive by burglars in Bihar for resisting robbery attempt
326.article_body: A 34-year-old man was burnt alive by a group of unidentified persons for resisting a robbery attempt in Bihar's Munger. After being set on fire, the man ran into Munger's Dasharathpur railway station. Station officials and Railway Protection Force personnel took the victim to the hospital where he died during treatment. He is survived by his wife and two children.

327.title: Sri Lankan lawmakers to elect new President tomorrow
327.article_body: Sri Lankan lawmakers will elect the country's new President tomorrow (July 20). The candidates are Acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe, Sinhala Buddhist nationalist Dullas Alahapperuma and leftist leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake. Last week, Gotabaya Rajapaksa vacated the President's office, following public protests against his government's alleged mismanagement of the economy.

328.title: Fires erupt across UK as it records its hottest day ever, pics surface
328.article_body: The south of England and Wales saw multiple fires on Tuesday as temperatures in the UK breached the 40 degrees Celsius mark for the first time ever. London Fire Brigade declared a major incident as wildfires spread in several locations with houses going up in flames in some areas. Pictures showed huge plumes of smoke rising from homes and parks.

329.title: We are not cars where you can fill us up with petrol: Ben Stokes on ODI retirement
329.article_body: Talking about his decision to retire from ODIs, England Test captain Ben Stokes said, "We’re not cars where you can fill us up with petrol." The 31-year-old all-rounder added, "The schedule is jam-packed, and you’re asking a lot of the players to keep putting in 100% of their efforts every time you walk onto the field for your country."

330.title: Told him I wanted a CSK jersey not Team India one: Pakistan's Haris Rauf on meeting Dhoni
330.article_body: Recalling meeting MS Dhoni during the T20 World Cup 2021, Pakistan pacer Haris Rauf said, "I asked him to give me one of his shirts but I told him...I wanted a CSK jersey and not the Team India one." Rauf added, "He told me he'll surely send me that. I finally received it when I was in Australia."

331.title: Cong coming to power important than me becoming CM: DK Shivakumar
331.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar on Tuesday said that Congress coming to power is more important than him becoming the Chief Minister of Karnataka. "Only if the Congress party comes to power, the post of Chief Minister will be available," DK Shivakumar said. "The party high command will decide who should be the CM candidate," he added.

332.title: Stokes cares about everyone in England's dressing room: Teammate Wood
332.article_body: England pacer Mark Wood said teammate Ben Stokes, who announced his retirement from ODI cricket, is a "natural leader" and will be a big miss for the team. "Stokes is an alpha guy but he cares about everyone in that dressing room...wants to make sure that they are alright," he added. Stokes made his ODI debut in August 2011.

333.title: Albania, North Macedonia begin membership talks with EU
333.article_body: Albania and North Macedonia on Tuesday began talks with the European Union for membership. The EU's Executive Commission in 2018 had recommended membership negotiations start, but Germany, the Netherlands, France and finally Bulgaria held up the process with different demands. Albania and North Macedonia, which are NATO members, have received criticism for taking in migrants from outside the bloc.

334.title: 24-year-old man arrested with country-made pistol in Jammu
334.article_body: The police arrested a 24-year-old man with a country-made pistol in Jammu on Tuesday, officials said. The pistol was recovered from the man, named Akshay Kumar, during a routine check. Kumar runs a drug rehabilitation centre at Jammu's Gharota village in the name of Ayodhya foundation, the officials said.

335.title: Woman lynched in WB for alleged illicit relation with son-in-law
335.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was allegedly lynched by a mob in a village in West Bengal's Murshidabad district early on Tuesday for having an illicit relationship with her son-in-law, police said. The woman's 33-year-old son-in-law was also beaten up. Villagers had warned the man not to visit his mother-in-law when her husband was away for work.

336.title: ED arrests Jharkhand CM Soren's political aide in money laundering case
336.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren's political aide Pankaj Mishra was arrested by Enforcement Directorate on Tuesday in connection with an alleged money laundering case related to illegal mining. Mishra was taken to a Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court. ED had earlier said that it had seized ₹11.88 crore lying in 37 bank accounts belonging to Mishra and others.

337.title: I bought a third-hand car for ₹60,000 after first few films: Kartik Aaryan
337.article_body: Kartik Aaryan has said when he first joined Bollywood, he didn't have any car. "The first car...I bought was after a couple of films, a third-hand car...for around ₹60,000," he stated. "I took it specifically because I was still taking an auto to the red carpet, or going on a bike, or getting a lift," he added.

338.title: Healthcare startup PharmEasy plans $200 mn fundraising: Report
338.article_body: PharmEasy, a healthcare startup that provides medicines and medical services on its platform, is currently in talks with investors to raise $200 million but at a valuation 15%-25% lower than last year's $5.1 billion, according to reports. This could reduce PharmEasy's valuation for the funding round to $3.8 billion. Further, the company's IPO, targeted for this year, has been delayed.

339.title: Thank you: Shriver on Russia's Daria Kasatkina coming out as gay
339.article_body: After Russia's top-ranked singles player Daria Kasatkina came out as gay in a video interview posted online on Monday, former women's doubles world number one Pam Shriver took to Twitter and wrote, "Thank you!" World number 12 Kasatkina said she is dating Olympic medallist figure skater Natalia Zabiiako. Meanwhile, Kasatkina lost in first round of Hamburg European Open on Sunday.

340.title: 3 missing, 11 injured after gas explosion in China's Tianjin
340.article_body: At least 11 people were wounded and three were reported missing after a gas explosion in an apartment building in the Chinese city of Tianjin on Tuesday. The explosion took place during the early morning hours, Xinhua reported citing local authorities. The victims sustained non-life-threatening injuries, the local government said.

341.title: Met injured visa officer in Sri Lanka: Indian High Commission
341.article_body: Indian High Commission officials in Sri Lanka on Tuesday visited the Director of Indian Visa Centre Vivek Varma who sustained "grievous injuries" during an "unprovoked assault" on Monday night. According to the High Commission, the alleged assault took place near the capital city of Colombo. Local authorities have been informed about the matter, the High Commission added.

342.title: Acclaimed Iranian filmmaker jailed for 'anti-govt propaganda'
342.article_body: Acclaimed Iranian filmmaker Jafar Panahi has been ordered to serve a full six-year prison sentence, which was given to him in 2010 for 'anti-government propaganda'. Panahi was arrested earlier this month after he went to the prosecutor's office to enquire about his colleagues, who were also arrested by authorities amid a government crackdown. Panahi's films have won several international awards.

343.title: Hangzhou Asian Games, delayed due to COVID, rescheduled for September 2023
343.article_body: The postponed Asian Games will be held from September 23 to October 8 2023 in Hangzhou, the Olympic Council of Asia (OCA) announced on Tuesday. The Games could not be hosted this year because of rising COVID-19 cases in China. The 19th Asian Games were originally planned to be held in Hangzhou from September 10-25 this year.

344.title: Govt shouldn't give security to those speaking against religion: BJP
344.article_body: BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh on Tuesday said that some people make incorrect statements on religion and the country only to get security and urged the government to not give them any protection. He also said that suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma shouldn't get security just because she's a member of the ruling party.

345.title: 2-year-old boy drowns in a swimming pool in Lonavala, dies
345.article_body: Police said a two-year-old boy drowned in the swimming pool of a bungalow in Maharashtra's Lonavala, where his family had gathered to celebrate his second birthday. The incident took place on July 13 at the bungalow which the Nashik-based family had booked. "The parents...were busy on the first floor...when the toddler fell in the swimming pool," an official said.

346.title: ED arrests ex-Mumbai Police chief Sanjay Pandey in NSE phone tapping case
346.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday arrested former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey in connection with a money laundering case linked to the alleged illegal phone tapping of National Stock Exchange (NSE) employees. The 1986-batch IPS officer retired from service on June 30. He has also served as the acting Maharashtra director general of police.

347.title: New pic taken by world's most powerful telescope shows purple galactic swirl in universe
