347.article_body: A new picture taken by the world's most powerful telescope, the James Webb Space Telescope, shows a purple galactic swirl in the universe. The image is of the centre of the spiral galaxy NGC 628. The image is a composite of three sets of data at different wavelengths taken by JWST’s mid-infrared instrument team.

348.title: Man dies by suicide after killing same-sex partner in MP's Betul
348.article_body: A 32-year-old man strangulated his partner to death before dying by suicide in MP's Betul when the latter threatened him of disclosing their homosexual relationship, police said on Tuesday. The accused's body was found on Saturday and his partner's body was recovered three days later, police added. The murder victim was in a relationship with other men, the probe found.

349.title: Rajasthan gangster wanted in 35 criminal cases held by Gujarat ATS
349.article_body: A Rajasthan-based gangster, Arvind Singh Bika, who was wanted in 35 criminal cases including murder, rioting and looting across three states was arrested by the Gujarat Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS). Two pistols and live ammunition were recovered from him, police said. "He was often seen posting threatening videos on social media with him posing with weapons," an ATS official said.

350.title: Kalam was true representation of Indo-Islamic culture: Prez Kovind
350.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday said former President APJ Abdul Kalam was an ideal representation of Indo-Islamic culture. "He (Kalam) used to specially meet school children. He was sure that future generations will form the golden future of the country," President Kovind said. "I also believe that girls will have an important role in the country's development," he added.

351.title: Monkeypox testing has started at NIV Alappuzha: Kerala Minister
351.article_body: Kerala Health Minister Veena George on Tuesday said that the state has started monkeypox testing at National Institute of Virology (NIV) Alappuzha. "Kits have been brought to NIV Alappuzha from Pune...Testing samples in Kerala will reduce the time duration to get the result," Veena George said. This comes after Kerala confirmed the second case of monkeypox on Monday.

352.title: Red alert for heavy rain issued in 7 U'khand districts for tomorrow
352.article_body: India Meteorological Department has issued a red alert for heavy rain in Dehradun, Tehri, Pauri, Nainital, Champawat, Udham Singh Nagar and Haridwar for Wednesday. The heavy rainfall could trigger more landslides in sensitive areas of the state. Travellers have been advised to avoid unnecessary journeys. CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said the disaster management authorities are on alert.

353.title: Sunak among final 3 contenders for UK PM, wins most support in latest voting round
353.article_body: Former British Chancellor Rishi Sunak is among the final three contenders for the post of British PM after lawmaker Kemi Badenoch was eliminated in the latest round of voting. Sunak won the most support from Conservative Party members of the British Parliament. Trade Minister Penny Mordaunt and Foreign Secretary Liz Truss are the other two candidates still in the race.

354.title: Rebel Sena MP is party's leader in Lok Sabha, says Maha CM Shinde
354.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has recognised rebel Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale as the party's floor leader in the Lower House of Parliament. "Shiv Sena MPs too have supported us in our stand to uphold ideals of Balasaheb Thackeray," Shinde added, while speaking to mediapersons in Delhi.

355.title: Failure of entire govt machinery: Kejriwal on killing of Haryana DSP
355.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said the killing of a DSP in Haryana was the result of the failure of the entire government machinery in the state. "How will the public be safe where the police is not safe?" he asked. The DSP investigating illegal stone-mining was killed on Tuesday when a truck drove into him, officials said.

356.title: PIL seeking my removal filed out of vendetta & vengeance: CBI chief
356.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) chief Subodh Jaiswal has told Bombay HC that public interest litigation (PIL) seeking his removal from the post has been filed out of "vendetta" and "vengeance". The PIL, which was filed by a retired police officer, stated that Jaiswal has doubtful credibility. Notably, the petitioner had also challenged Jaiswal's previous appointment as Maharashtra DGP.

357.title: Hindustan Unilever's net profit rises 14% YoY to ₹2,391 cr in Q1
357.article_body: Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) on Tuesday reported a 13.85% YoY rise in its consolidated net profit to ₹2,391 crore for the March-June quarter. Its standalone net profit was at ₹2,191 crore. HUL's revenue from operations rose 19.46% YoY to ₹14,331 crore while its earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA) margin was at 23.2% in Q1 FY23.

358.title: Qatar's Barshim wins 3rd straight high jump gold at World Championships
358.article_body: Tokyo Olympics gold medallist Mutaz Barshim of Qatar jumped a world-leading 2.37 metres to win high jump gold medal for the third successive time at World Athletics Championships in Oregon on Monday. South Korea's Sanghyeok Woo took silver (2.35 metres), while Ukraine's Andriy Protsenko won bronze (2.33 metres). Notably, 31-year-old Barshim went beyond his own season's best of 2.30 metres.

359.title: K'taka officials isolate co-passengers of India's 2nd monkeypox patient
359.article_body: Authorities in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada district have isolated co-passengers of India's second monkeypox patient. The 31-year-old man from Kannur arrived at Mangalore International Airport (MIA) from Dubai on July 13. The District Surveillance Officer said as many as 191 passengers were in the aircraft along with him and 11 of them were from Dakshina Kannada.

360.title: Farmer files complaint against Lord Indra over lack of rains in UP, pic goes viral
360.article_body: A UP farmer submitted a written complaint to the local administration against the Hindu God of rain "Indra Devta (Bhagwan ji)", citing a lack of rainfall. A picture of the complaint filed by Sumit Kumar Yadav has gone viral. He wrote, "All are suffering...I, therefore, request you (District Magistrate) to take action against Indra Bhagwan."

361.title: I retired from ODIs due to horrendous schedule, ECB banned me from T20Is too: Pietersen
361.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen took to Twitter to take a dig at the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB). "I once said the schedule was horrendous and I couldn’t cope, so I retired from ODI cricket & the ECB banned me from [T20Is] too," he tweeted. Pietersen's tweet comes after England Test captain Ben Stokes announced his retirement from ODIs.

362.title: Part of world's most powerful telescope permanently damaged by space rock: Report
362.article_body: Scientists have said part of James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful telescope, suffered permanent damage due to a series of micrometeorite strikes. The micrometeoroid which hit a segment in the period May 22-24 caused significant uncorrectable change in the overall figure of that segment, said scientists. The telescope was built at a cost of $10 billion.

363.title: Govt releases list of cities and towns renamed in the last 5 years
363.article_body: The Centre gave its nod for renaming seven cities and towns, including Allahabad to Prayagraj, in last five years, the Lok Sabha was informed. The approval was given to renaming of Rajahmundry (Rajamahendravaram), Nagar Untari (Shri Banshidhar Nagar), Birsinghpur Pali (Maa Birasini Dham), Hoshangabad Nagar (Narmadapuram), Babai (Makhan Nagar) and Shri Hargobindpur city (Shri Hargobindpur Sahib).

364.title: India on course to achieve 8-8.5% growth based on Q1 data: Govt
364.article_body: India is on course to achieve projected 8-8.5% growth based on high frequency indicators for the first quarter of FY23, the Finance Ministry said on Tuesday. Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said the government has cut excise duty on petrol and diesel and special excise duty/cess on petrol, diesel and jet fuel exports to ensure continued growth momentum.

365.title: Huge sinkhole opens up in New York City, swallows van; video goes viral
365.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a huge sinkhole opening up in New York City. In the video, a van can be seen toppling into the sinkhole after heavy rains pounded the area. No injuries were reported in connection with the sinkhole, officials said. As per reports, 75 customers were left without water service because of the sinkhole.

366.title: Canada temple issues security measures after Gandhi statue defaced
366.article_body: The management of the Vishnu temple in Canada's Toronto has issued new security measures after a statue of Mahatma Gandhi situated there was defaced last week. Additional security cameras will be installed near the temple complex to monitor the surroundings, an official said. India had released a statement on the statue's desecration, terming the incident as a "hate crime".

367.title: Man stabs wife, her live-in partner to death in Bhopal; arrested
367.article_body: A man, Sunil Malviya, was arrested for stabbing his wife and her live-in partner to death in a market in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal. Station in-charge Alok Srivastava said the victim, 22-year-old Aruna Malviya, was living separately with her 5-year-old daughter and 25-year-old Rajendra. Sunil tracked the timing of their return and attacked them on Monday evening, police added.

368.title: Police arrest 682 criminals under Operation Akraman in Haryana
368.article_body: Haryana Police arrested 682 criminals including proclaimed offenders, bail jumpers and confiscated illicit arms, liquor and narcotic substances under a special drive called Operation Akraman. DGP PK Agrawal said about 5,000 personnel in 616 teams raided locations following tip-offs. The aim was to check smuggling of weapons and eradicate drug menace in the state, police added.

369.title: Situation is exceptional but comparing it with India is ignorant: Jaishankar on Lanka
369.article_body: The government hosted an all-party meeting on Sri Lanka crisis on Tuesday, during which External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar briefed the attendees, including opposition MPs. "The situation is unprecedented and India is worried about it. But drawing comparisons (with India) is uninformed," said Jaishankar. The opposition has raised concerns about India's economy in the wake of Lankan crisis.

370.title: Russia seeks explanation from India over detained cargo ship in Cochin
370.article_body: Russian Embassy in India has said it's aware of the Russian cargo ship detention in Cochin, on board which military cargo for Indian Armed Forces was delivered. The embassy has filed an official request for an explanation of the incident's circumstances. "We've also asked...MEA to ensure unconditional observance of...rights of...Russian shipowners and crew," it said.

371.title: State taking all precautions against monkeypox: TN Health Minister
371.article_body: Tamil Nadu Health Minister Ma Subramanian said the state is taking all precautions to prevent the spread of monkeypox and is monitoring those coming from abroad at four international airports in the state. Wards and sufficient number of beds have been allocated to deal with any possible cases of monkeypox that may be reported in the coming days, Subramanian added.

372.title: KCR dedicated to eradicating poverty in Telangana: Minister
372.article_body: Telangana Minority Welfare Minister Koppula Eshwar said CM K Chandrashekar Rao is dedicated to eradicating poverty among minorities in the state. A number of gurukuls are being started in English medium to provide high-quality education, he added. "Earlier...subsidies [for minorities] were only 20 to 30%, but after the formation of Telangana, KCR increased them to 60 to 95%," Eshwar said.

373.title: 22 killed, 33 injured as bus hits truck in south Egypt
373.article_body: At least 22 people were killed and 33 people were injured when a passenger bus hit a trailer truck in southern Egypt's Minya province on Tuesday. The trailer truck's tire was being changed on the roadside of a highway which links Egypt's capital Cairo to the country's south when the accident occurred. The passenger bus was going to Cairo.

374.title: Check-in using face recognition at Bengaluru airport from Aug 15
374.article_body: The first phase of Centre's Digi Yatra project, which allows passengers to check in at airport using facial recognition technology, will commence at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport on August 15. Under the project, passengers will pass through check-points through a contactless process, using facial features to establish their identities, which would be linked to boarding passes.

375.title: India & China to maintain stability along LAC after 16th round of talks
375.article_body: India and China agreed to maintain stability on ground and resolve relevant issues pertaining to Line of Actual Control (LAC) in 16th round of corps commander-level talks held on Sunday. In a joint press release, both sides reaffirmed that resolution of remaining issues would enable progress in bilateral ties. Talks were held at Chushul-Moldo border meeting point on Indian side.

376.title: K'taka family announces ₹50,000 reward for finding missing parrot
376.article_body: A family that rears parrots at home in Karnataka's Tumakuru has announced that anybody who returns their missing parrot or gives information about it will be given ₹50,000 as reward. Animal activist Ravi, who owns the African grey parrot, said 'Rustuma' has been missing since Saturday from Jayanagar locality. "By mistake, it has flown away...It cannot go far," Ravi added.

377.title: I don't think I am the best player right now: World no. 6 Alcaraz
377.article_body: World number six Carlos Alcaraz said he doesn't think that he's the best player currently. "I mean, Novak Djokovic won Wimbledon, Rafael Nadal [won] Roland-Garros and Australian Open, so there are a lot of great players ahead of me right now," he added. The 19-year-old Spaniard has won four ATP titles this year, including two Masters 1000s.

378.title: Estonia's new government headed by PM Kaja Kallas sworn in
378.article_body: Estonia's new government has been sworn in, giving Prime Minister Kaja Kallas a ruling majority. Last week, Kallas resigned after the previous coalition government was disbanded over ally Centre Party's opposition to the government's reform of primary education. The new government will last till the elections in March 2023.

379.title: 1 accused in Haryana DSP's killing arrested; was shot in leg in encounter
379.article_body: One person involved in the killing of Tauru DSP Surender Singh in Haryana's Nuh has been arrested, Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij has confirmed. According to police, the accused was arrested after an encounter, during which he was shot in the leg. "Other [accused] will be arrested soon...We're very serious as the attack has happened on our police," Vij added.

380.title: Mumbai airport sees 132% growth in passenger traffic in 6 months
380.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport has seen a 132% increase in passenger traffic in the first six months of 2022, compared to the first six months of 2021, reports said. Around 1.30 lakh flight movements were recorded across domestic and international destinations and 1.336 crore domestic passengers travelled via 97,460 flights. May was the best month for air travel.

381.title: Srinagar makes masks compulsory at public places as COVID cases rise
381.article_body: The district administration in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Tuesday made use of face masks compulsory at all public places with immediate effect because of a spike in COVID-19 cases. The rule will be in place till further orders. All district and sectoral officers have been asked to ensure the usage of face masks by all officials in the office.

382.title: Udhayakumar elected as Deputy Leader of Opposition in TN Assembly
382.article_body: AIADMK has elected MLA RB Udhayakumar as Deputy Leader of the Opposition in Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly. The post was earlier held by former Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam, who was expelled from the party earlier this month. Further, MLA SS Krishnamurthy has replaced Manoj Pandian as AIADMK's Deputy Secretary. Earlier, Pandian was expelled from the party for supporting Panneerselvam.

383.title: Nearly 30,000 recruited in J&K's public sector since 2019: Govt
383.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration has recruited nearly 30,000 people in the public sector since 2019, Union Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai said in Lok Sabha on Tuesday. Rai added that 5.2 lakh people were employed through the self-employment schemes from August 2019 to June 2022. In August 2019, Jammu and Kashmir's special status was scrapped.

384.title: Distance criteria for EWS admissions in Delhi pvt schools changed to 3 km
384.article_body: Economically Weaker Section (EWS) students seeking admissions in Delhi's private schools will be able to choose an institution within 3 kms (instead of the earlier 1 km) of their residence, the Directorate of Education said. In a computerised draw of lots, students in a 1-km radius are selected and chances of those residing 3 kms away get minimised, officials said.

385.title: Dog-like robot with a virtual spinal cord learns to walk in 1 hour; video released
385.article_body: A dog-like robot with a "virtual spinal cord" has learned to walk from scratch in just one hour, researchers from Germany's Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems claimed. The robot, named Morti, features reflexes just like an animal and learns from its mistakes. It continuously compares sent and expected sensor information, runs reflex loops, and adapts its motor control patterns.

386.title: I painted his face but was still recognised: Ex-Barcelona player on Ronaldo
386.article_body: Former Barcelona player Boudewijn Zenden revealed an interesting story of his teammate and Brazilian footballer, Ronaldo Nazario, when the latter had recently won the 1994 FIFA World Cup. "I took Ronaldo to...the best yearly carnival [of] the Netherlands...He wore a clown outfit...and I painted his face, but people still recognised him. His smile...revealed his true identity," Zenden said.

387.title: Hottest day recorded in history of UK as temperatures cross 40°C for 1st time
387.article_body: The hottest day has been recorded in the history of UK as temperatures hit 40.2°C at London Heathrow Airport on Tuesday. The previous hottest day in UK (38.7°C) was recorded in Cambridge University Botanic Garden on July 25, 2019. Many sites across UK surpassed the 2019 record today. Charlwood recorded temperatures of 39.9°C, while temperatures reached 39.6°C in Kew Gardens.

388.title: Hyderabad reported zero bad air days from 2019-21: Govt
388.article_body: Hyderabad reported zero bad air days from 2019 to 2021, as per a parliamentary report from the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change. Hyderabad's air quality index (AQI) was below 200 during this period. Visakhapatnam saw 25 bad air days in 2019, 23 in 2020 and 21 in 2021.

389.title: 12,611 enemy properties left behind by Pakistani, Chinese citizens
389.article_body: A total of 12,611 enemy properties were left behind by people who have taken citizenship of Pakistan and China, the Lok Sabha was informed on Tuesday. Union Minister of State for Home Ajay Kumar Mishra said out of the 12,611 properties, 12,485 were related to Pakistani nationals and 126 to Chinese citizens.

390.title: 4 men arrested for offering namaz at Lulu mall in Uttar Pradesh
390.article_body: Four men were arrested by the Uttar Pradesh Police on Tuesday, days after a video of them allegedly offering namaz at Lulu mall in Lucknow surfaced online. The accused were identified after checking surveillance footage from the mall, police said. The arrests came following demands of several Hindu right wing groups seeking permission to recite Hanuman Chalisa in the mall.

391.title: Brazilian Amazon lost 18 trees per second in 2021: Report
391.article_body: According to a report by Mapbiomas, deforestation in the Brazilian Amazon increased by more than 20% in 2021 and the rainforest faced deforestation at a rate of 18 trees per second. The report added that Brazil lost 42,000 square kilometres of tree cover in the last three years, a landmass equivalent to the area of the Rio de Janeiro state.

392.title: Baby-sized fibroid removed from 38-yr-old woman's uterus in Pune
392.article_body: A 5.6 kg fibroid, equivalent to the size of a full-term baby, was removed surgically from the uterus of a 38-year-old woman in Pune. "On arrival, we found that [the patient]...had a history of...abnormally heavy...bleeding and anaemia for a year," a doctor said. The patient, who was operated upon for two hours, was discharged 50 hours after her surgery.

393.title: Eka Care, platform which digitises medical records, raises $15 mn
393.article_body: Healthtech startup Eka Care, which helps digitise the medical records of Indian patients, has raised $15 million in its Series A round. The round, led by Hummingbird Ventures, saw participation from 3one4 Capital, Mirae Assets, Verlinvest, Aditya Birla Ventures, among others. Founded in 2020 by Vikalp Sahni and Deepak Tuli, the platform has over 30 million users and 5,000 doctors.

394.title: Artisan marketplace Lal10 raises $5.5 mn in pre-Series A round
394.article_body: Lal10, a cross-border marketplace for Indian artisans, raised $5.5 million in its pre-Series A funding round. The round, led by Yuj Ventures and Beyond Capital Ventures, saw participation from Spiral Ventures, Singularity Ventures, Asymmetry Ventures among others, and some prominent angels. Founded in 2017 by Maneet Gohil, Sanchit Govil and Albin Jose, the firm caters to grassroots MSMEs in India.

395.title: 90% road repair work completed in 3 days: Pune civic body
395.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Tuesday claimed that it has completed around 90% work to repair potholes in the city in just three days from July 15 to 18. PMC filled 848 potholes, repaired 65 chamber lids in this period, Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said. However, citizens living near the affected areas still complain about the poor condition of roads.

396.title: Cancel arms deal with Taiwan immediately: China to US
396.article_body: China has sought an immediate cancellation of the latest arms deal between the US and Taiwan, Chinese state media reported on Monday citing the country's Defence Ministry. On Friday, the Pentagon said that the US Department of State had given its nod for the potential sale of military technical assistance worth an estimated $108 million to Taiwan.

397.title: Commerce enablement firm AnyMind Group raises $29.4 mn in funding
397.article_body: AnyMind Group, an end-to-end commerce enablement company, has raised $29.4 million in a Series D funding round. Additionally, the company has also secured a $7.2 million credit facility from Japan-based corporate banking unit Mizuho Bank. So far, the brand support platform has acquired seven companies from various countries including Japan, Hong Kong, Thailand and India.

398.title: Filmmaker Avinash Das detained for sharing pic of Amit Shah with jailed IAS officer Pooja
398.article_body: Filmmaker Avinash Das was detained on Tuesday afternoon outside his Mumbai residence by a team of Gujarat Police. He was detained in connection with a case where he shared a photo on social media of Home Minister Amit Shah with arrested IAS officer Pooja Singhal. He is being brought to Ahmedabad for further action, an official said.

399.title: DCW issues notice after woman gives birth outside Safdarjung Hospital
399.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women has issued a notice to Safdarjung Hospital's Medical Superintendent after a woman gave birth on the floor outside the building of the hospital. The woman's family alleged that she was denied a maternity ward. However, a hospital spokesperson said that they did not deny the woman permission, adding that there was a lapse in communication.

400.title: Man detained for trying to chop off minor boy's ears in Assam
400.article_body: Police have detained a man in Assam's Tinsukia district for allegedly trying to chop off the ears of a minor boy who was reportedly in a relationship with his daughter. "Nearly half of both his ears were cut," said a staffer of the nursing home treating the victim. According to police, the boy was "mercilessly" beaten before the attempted mutilation.

401.title: Hardik a changed man now, I see sense of ambition in him: Manjrekar
401.article_body: Talking about Hardik Pandya, Sanjay Manjrekar said the India all-rounder is a changed man now. "I see a sense of ambition coming into him. And once you have that, wanting to grow within Indian cricket then there's tremendous motivation," he added. Hardik was adjudged 'Player of the Series' in India's 2-1 win in three-match ODI series against England.

402.title: Over 1,500 people killed in elephant attacks in last 3 years: Govt
402.article_body: About 1,578 people have died in elephant attacks in the country in the last three years, according to data shared by the Union Environment Ministry in Lok Sabha. Out of the total deaths reported due to elephant attacks, 585 people died in 16 states during 2019-20, 461 fatalities occurred in 2020-21 and 532 people died in 2021-22, the ministry added.
